runners.name: Vince Lombardi
runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.name: Roundhay Park
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late J D Gordon
runners.comment: Ran well here last October and has tended to run to form on his reappearances; a possible
runners.spotlight: Sole 7f win came at speedy Chester but he may be okay with the trip at this tight track; kept on for good third over 6f here (soft) last October and has tended to run to form on his reappearances; he's a possible.

quotes.race: QTS Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Roundhay Park was very relaxed today. He sometimes gets wound up but he came up yesterday and he's been very relaxed. He was given a great ride by Faye as there was no panic and no rush - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK Novice Auction Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: Roundhay Park was a bit buzzy so I'll give him a bit of a break now - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely horse and has been a great servant for the yard. He was second in the Shergar Cup Sprint Cup years back under Hayley Turner and was a top-class handicapper in his heyday. He finished last of 11 at York on Friday and hasn't shown it in his last two starts but the handicapper has just got him high enough. He's a little bit older now and we could do with a bit of help from the handicapper. 27-07-22

runners.name: Motawaazy
runners.comment: Sprint trips perhaps suit best nowadays but he has a good record here and is not ruled out
runners.spotlight: It's possible he's best served by sprint trips nowadays but seven visits to Catterick have yielded four wins (two over C&D in 2021, including on soft) and he scored on AW last December (5f, AW); not ruled out now back here.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Motawaazy is a gross horse and we thought he'd need the run as he carries a lot of condition but he's such a game horse - he lost both front shoes. He loves it round here - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Summer Of Lovely Offers Handicap
quotes.quote: That was very straightforward. Motawaazy jumped well from the gates and he likes to make the running so once I got to the front end we were away and gone. Hopefully he can go in again after that - Ben Curtis, jockey.

runners.name: Metabolt
runners.comment: Stretched by 8.3f on soft when last seen but remains unexposed and retains potential
runners.spotlight: 8.3f on soft ground at Nottingham appeared to stretch him last October when last seen; however, he showed promise last September with a maiden win at Carlisle (7f, good to soft) and a good handicap debut run at Chester (7.5f, good to soft), and this unexposed 4yo retains potential.

runners.name: Beauty Choice
runners.comment: Market check advised on stable debut but it's possible soft ground isn't ideal nowadays
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last October on penultimate run for William Jarvis and he also ran well over 7f last season; changed hands for 16,000gns last October and a market check is advised on stable debut, but it's possible that soft ground isn't ideal nowadays, especially at this trip.

runners.name: Legal Reform
runners.comment: C&D winner who wasn't winning out of turn when scoring at Southwell last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Missed the vast majority of 2022; kicked off this year with two good thirds and returned to winning ways at Southwell (7f, AW) last month; won off this mark over C&D (soft) in October 2021 and respected back on turf.

stable_tour.quote: He is a nice horse who has not done a great deal wrong. He won at Southwell in the spring and was a little unfortunate not to win at Chester in the summer when a head second to Praxeology. He is a genuine horse who likes the all-weather surfaces and appreciates cut underfoot. There are several races coming up in the next few weeks but I am waiting for the softer ground. The only all-weather track I will try and avoid with him is Kempton as he did not appear to enjoy his run around there last month. I am sure he will pick up a race or two this winter 23-09-21

runners.name: Ey Up Its The Boss
runners.owner: Mrs M Lingwood And S Bland
runners.comment: Well treated on last year's best form but needs to get back on track
runners.spotlight: Well treated on the pick of last year's progressive form at up to 7f and he's versatile ground-wise; may have needed last month's reappearance run at Newcastle but he was also a long way below his best on his final two outings last season and needs to get back on track.

runners.name: Shahnaz
runners.comment: Last year's wins were over 1m/8.3f but she's not ruled out on reappearance
runners.spotlight: There is a question mark regarding the drop back in trip on reappearance but she showed pace when winning three times last summer (1m/8.3f, including on good to soft) and she was stretched by 1m2f on heavy going at Doncaster last October when last seen; not ruled out.

runners.name: Parys Mountain

prev_owners.owner: Julie Martin & David R Martin & Partner

runners.comment: Four C&D wins, including this on reappearance two years ago; could play a leading role
runners.spotlight: Improved for his first run last season but won this two years ago on his reappearance (good to firm); last season ended with a win at Redcar (1m, heavy) and this four-time C&D winner could play a leading role if ready to rumble on his comeback.

quotes.race: Watch Racing UK With Free Trial Now Handicap
quotes.quote: That was cracking, Parys Mountain is a lovely horse. He's just got settled now, he was very free when we first got him but his brain has switched off and he's got it right. He's had a lot of racing and we won't run him on the all-weather, we'll put him away - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Like Sun Bets On Facebook Handicap
quotes.quote: Parys Mountain was a good third at Ripon last time when he made the running, but he settled better today. He's a very sound horse who goes well on this ground - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Special Mayson
runners.breeder: M H Sly & Mrs P M Sly
runners.owner: Michael H Sly & Mrs Pam Sly
runners.comment: Good fourth in this on last year's reappearance; capable of having a big say if on song
runners.spotlight: Below par more often than not last year but he was a good fourth in this on his reappearance (good to soft) and won a big-field handicap at Leicester (6f, good) last October; capable of having a big say if on song.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Special Mayson is still a bit green and they didn't go very quick which didn't suit but the second has given him a nice tow into it. - Dougie Costello, rider

runners.name: Magical Effect
runners.comment: Two wins last autumn and makes reappearance with trainer in good form; could be involved
runners.spotlight: Won twice last year, over C&D (heavy) in September and at Pontefract (6f, good to soft) in October; this 11yo makes his reappearance with his trainer in good form and he could be involved.

quotes.race: All New racinguk.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Magical Effect has been running consistently all year but for some reason things just haven't come together. We've always liked him, last year we thought he was a bit special. Maybe we have come up against a lot of sticky holding ground, whereas this is more fresh good to soft ground that he can go through. I'd like to think he'll go on from this, he might go for the Great St Wilfrid consolation race at Ripon next Saturday - trainer Ruth Carr

quotes.race: PPR Foundation Handicap
quotes.quote: Magical Effect is not entirely straightforward as he's quite highly strung but he settled into the race and has seen it out well. He's a horse with good ability and the big sprint handicaps are in reach if he can handle everything about those big days - Ruth Carr, trainer.

quotes.race: Project Management Scotland Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Magical Effect has had his problems mentally and James has done much of the work; no one else tends to ride him. Hopefully he's the type that once he does it once he can go on - Ruth Carr, trainer.

runners.name: Redrosezorro
runners.comment: 6f may be his best trip nowadays but he's not ruled out at favourite track on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Seven wins here for the now-retired Eric Alston, including on final run for that yard last October (6f, soft); 6f may be his best trip nowadays but he's not ruled out at his favourite track on stable/seasonal debut.

runners.name: Miss Calculation
runners.comment: Won at Thirsk (7f, soft) on Tuesday when back on turf; solid contender under a 5lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Some encouraging runs during AW campaign and built on those to win at Thirsk (7f, soft) last Tuesday; has conditions in her favour again today and she's a solid contender under a 5lb penalty.

runners.name: Langholm
runners.comment: Has run well on his last two reappearances and his C&D form figures read 210313
runners.spotlight: Below par last September when last seen but he's run well on his last two reappearances and his record here catches the eye, with C&D form figures of 210313; versatile ground-wise and he's in calculations.

runners.name: Punxsutawney Phil
runners.comment: Versatile sort; 1m4f AW winner in December; back from a break; perhaps best watched
runners.spotlight: Has won a bumper, hurdle, chase and on the AW but is having first run on turf on the Flat; poor effort on the AW in January when last seen out having won over 1m4f at Wolverhampton in December; perhaps best watched on return from a break.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race) (AW)
quotes.quote: Punxsutawney Phil has been working well and has a bit about him. We took him away last week and he worked really well and we were expecting a nice run. We think he's a really nice horse. To be fair to Dan he bred the horse and the mare they had they lost her, but she's bred a few nice horses and this is the best of them all - Brian Ellison, trainer.

runners.name: Arctic Fox

prev_owners.owner: Colin Taylor And Miss Kay Wilding

runners.comment: Conditions suit; out of form at the end of last season; usually needs a race after a break
runners.spotlight: Conditions suit; out of form towards the end of last season; has had a break and usually needs a race or two to hit peak form.

quotes.race: Queen Mother's Cup Handicap (For Lady Amateur Riders)
quotes.quote: It's the right time of year for the three-year-olds taking on the older horses. Arctic Fox has won three in a row and the step up in trip has not bothered her - Richard Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Oasis Prince
runners.comment: 2m winner here in 2022; lacks a recent run and perhaps better on good ground
runners.spotlight: Course winner last season (2m, good); lacks a recent run and perhaps better on good ground.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap
quotes.quote: Oasis Prince is a lovely horse who has got better and better since his first run. It was quite tough out there with the headwind - Franny Norton, rider.

runners.name: Golden Keeper
runners.comment: Won maiden h'cap last season; gelded since; a possible though regular headgear left off
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden handicap at Beverley last season (1m4f, good to firm; cheekpieces on); fair efforts on the AW at up to 1m6f with same headgear later in the year; has since been gelded and is a possible contender although headgear is left off.

runners.name: Quercus Robur
runners.comment: Winner of four of last eight races; has won on good to soft; interesting despite high mark
runners.spotlight: Has won four of his last eight races, the last two over 2m on Newcastle AW for this yard; has won on good to soft, remains in form and is an interesting contender despite career-high mark.

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't go that quick and it can't turn into a sprint with Quercus Robur, he needs everything to go smooth. The drop back in trip didn't suit him last time. Back up to two miles today was ideal. He's a bit quirky, going down to the start he was a bit reluctant but you just have to kid him into races a little bit - Kevin Stott, jockey.

runners.name: Gift Of Raaj
runners.comment: Hurdles winner in Feb; stays well, acts on good to soft and should give a good account
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles in February but poor run two weeks ago; stays well, has won on good to soft and should give a good account if back to best.

stable_tour.quote: He has gone the right way this season and has won twice, including when winning by a nose at Doncaster over 1m6½f. He's a lovely, big horse who has run consistently all season. He might just be able to win again off his mark but after that it might be his limit on the Flat. He's an out-and-out stayer and would be a proper horse if his owners sent him hurdling or chasing. 20-07-22

runners.name: Mister Camacho
runners.comment: Placed six times, including on comeback, but a 13-race maiden; place chance
runners.spotlight: Placed six times, including at Doncaster ten days ago (1m4f, soft), but is somewhat frustrating as he has yet to win in 13 attempts; place chance again.

runners.name: Divine Libra
runners.comment: Holds major claims if back to debut form and settling better than last time
runners.spotlight: Both starts over 7f on AW last autumn, better effort when clear second at Kempton on debut; holds major claims if back to that form and settling better than last time (raced freely, still wasn't beaten far).

runners.name: Headabovetherest
runners.comment: Needs further progress to make a successful reappearance
runners.spotlight: Both 2yo outings came over 7f at Thirsk, better effort when sixth last time; gelded since; needs further progress to make a successful reappearance and may find easier opportunities in handicaps.

runners.name: Mascani
runners.comment: £35,000 yearling; by Mastercraftstman; market helpful
runners.spotlight: £35,000 yearling; Mastercraftsman half-brother to 5f-1m winner Arcanears; dam Listed-placed 6f-7f winner, half-sister to 5f 2yo winner Nestor Protector; one of two newcomers in the field; market helpful.

runners.name: Naughty George
runners.owner: Naughty But Nice And Ours For Life
runners.comment: Minor form in 7f contests last autumn
runners.spotlight: Minor form in 7f contests on AW/turf last autumn, finishing sixth both times; similar position awaits unless he has improved over the winter.

runners.name: Three Yorkshiremen
runners.owner: John Rhodes Peter Timmins & Dale Wilsdon
runners.comment: Largely consistent last term and his form stacks up well; solid contender
runners.spotlight: 0-5 last term but proved consistent in the main and his form, latterly in useful nurseries over 7f/1m, stacks up well; gelded since last run; acts on slow ground; solid contender back at novice level.

runners.name: Yorkstone
runners.owner: The Mick & David Easterby Racing Group
runners.comment: Looks a prospect for ordinary handicaps
runners.spotlight: Both juvenile starts came over 7f at Redcar, better effort when modest fifth in novice event latest; soundly beaten in claimer on debut; looks a prospect for ordinary handicaps.

runners.name: Intoxicata
runners.comment: Possible improver with Wolverhampton reappearance under her belt
runners.spotlight: Comfortably held in both outings (turf/AW) but she cost 200,000euros as a yearling and may do better yet; possible improver with Wolverhampton reappearance under her belt.

runners.name: Loveliest
runners.comment: Unpromising debut in 5f maiden at Thirsk last week
runners.spotlight: Unpromising debut (never figured, achieved little on form) in 5f maiden at Thirsk last week; this longer trip needs to prompt a major step forward.

runners.name: Wurkin Ninetofive
runners.comment: Her second 2yo effort was better than the first; could go well
runners.spotlight: Both 2yo appearances came over 6f at Carlisle, better effort when keeping-on fourth latest; gives the impression this extra furlong will suit; could go well.

runners.name: Montelusa
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late James Bowers
runners.comment: 0-7 last season; absent since July; heed the market signals on return
runners.spotlight: 0-7 last season; form dipped on final outing (in July) but proved generally consistent otherwise and could well bounce back, provided he doesn't need this reappearance run; heed the market signals in that respect.

runners.name: Shines Ambition
runners.comment: Could go well with Southwell reappearance under his belt
runners.spotlight: 0-10; placed several times over 6f last year; ordinary effort (fourth of six) in 5f novice event at Southwell on reappearance but may fare better with that outing under his belt; mark has dropped another 3lb.

stable_tour.quote: He was narrowly beaten at Newcastle on his first start for us and then finished third at Chester. We're keen to give him plenty of experience, so we decided to run him again quickly at Pontefract, where he did well to finish third in a 6f novice on Friday. He's shown plenty of promise. We feel he's a handicapper but he could be better than that. We need to get a mark and then we'll go from there. 20-07-22

runners.name: Premier Option
runners.breeder: Oghill House Stud & Joseph M Burke
runners.comment: Went very close over C&D last August; likely player if back to that form
runners.spotlight: Brings mixed messages as he twice went very close at novice/maiden level last August, including over C&D, but achieved little in two handicaps subsequently; has a fighting chance if back to the August form.

runners.name: Jamie Bond
runners.comment: May improve now handicapping on first run since being gelded; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Not totally straightforward last year as he has sweated up, hung left and raced freely; nonetheless he showed signs of ability and may improve now handicapping on first run since being gelded; shortlisted.

runners.name: Grandad Bob
runners.comment: Possible improver on handicap debut and first run since having wind surgery; interesting
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly over C&D when last seen but a combination of subsequent wind surgery and switch to handicap level may well prompt a much bigger effort; his other 2yo runs were encouraging; trainer won this race with handicap newcomers in 2014 and 2022 (SPs 6-1 and 14-1); interesting.

runners.name: South Dakota Sioux
runners.comment: Exposed sort but ran well on latest AW start; not without a chance
runners.spotlight: Exposed sort who is 0-12 and has raced mostly on AW; however, generally in decent form this year, most recently close fourth at Southwell (5f) last week; not without a chance, off the same mark.

4:48.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap

runners.name: Scottish Wind
runners.comment: Promise in novice/maidens in 2022; stable in fine form; interesting on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Shaped well on good to soft/soft on all three starts on the Flat in novice/maiden company last season (1m3f/1m4f); also some fair efforts over hurdles in the winter; interesting on handicap debut particularly with his trainer's Flat horses in such good form.

runners.name: Casa Luna
runners.comment: Ex-Roger Varian; promise in AW novices but well beaten in two handicaps; turf debut
runners.spotlight: Ex-Roger Varian; showed some promise in AW novices but well beaten in two AW handicaps for present yard after being bought for 16,000gns in February; turf debut.

runners.name: Turner Girl
runners.comment: Won over 1m6f here last year; not progress and well beaten final start; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Won 1m6f handicap here off 2lb lower in August (good to firm) but didn't progress and was well beaten on good to soft on final start; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Trailblazer
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden; fair efforts in AW handicaps; headgear back on; a possible
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; some fair efforts in AW handicaps at up to 1m4f at Newcastle for this yard and can be forgiven a poor run there last week as he met trouble in running; cheekpieces back on; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: He won back-to-back races either side of Christmas last season. I was very disappointed with how quickly he stopped in his last two runs so we have sent him off to get his breathing sorted out. Last time out at Chepstow you would have been quite happy if you had backed him as he was travelling sweetly but he cut out very quickly, so hopefully we can locate the problem. He will jump a fence in time. 19-10-21

runners.name: Lord Torranaga
runners.comment: Exposed; only turf win was over 1m6f here (2021); fair AW run latest; place chance
runners.spotlight: Exposed sort; only turf win in 25 attempts was over 1m6f here on good to soft in October 2021; fair run on the AW last time; place chance.

quotes.race: 29th And 30th May Antiques Fair Handicap
quotes.quote: Lord Torranaga was really tough. He had to dig deep as it was a muddling race with only four runners and the pace was stop-start, but he did it nicely in the end - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Lechro
runners.comment: 11-race maiden; chance on her Hamilton second last year but below par on AW in 2023
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; chance on her close second in a Hamilton handicap in September (1m3f, good to soft) but below par on AW this year; others stronger.

runners.name: Give Grace
runners.comment: Two fair runs over 1m2f last term; can pull hard so not sure to be suited by 1m4f
runners.spotlight: A couple of fair runs over 1m2f last season, on second occasion finishing runner-up in a Redcar seller (heavy); can pull hard so not sure to be suited by step up to 1m4f.

runners.name: Coconut Bay
runners.comment: Won over 1m2f on AW for Hughie Morrison in 2022; hood tried on first run at 1m4f.
runners.spotlight: 1m2f AW winner for Hughie Morrison in August before 15,000gns sale; pulled hard when fifth over 1m2f at Newcastle on stable debut last month; wears a hood now stepping up to 1m4f for the first time.

runners.name: Sugarpiehoneybunch
runners.comment: Off the mark in strongly run h'cap last week; 5lb penalty; this may not pan out so well
runners.spotlight: Off the mark on first run at this trip when coming late to take a strongly run handicap at Thirsk last week (soft); has claims with a 5lb penalty but this is not sure to pan out as well.

runners.name: Turbulent Power
runners.comment: 22-race maiden who needs to improve on recent efforts to get into the shake-up.
runners.spotlight: 22-race maiden who is 1lb out of the handicap and needs to improve on recent efforts to get into the shake-up.

2:10.race_name: Flat Season Starts Now Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Dandy Spirit

prev_owners.owner: Grange Park Racing Club & R Fell

runners.comment: Won off 6lb higher last August but plenty to prove regarding current form
runners.spotlight: Now 6lb lower than when winning at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) last August and he may not have taken to Tapeta on his two runs this year; however, plenty to prove regarding current form and he's untested on soft going.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter @DundalkStadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Dandy Spirit did it well and we would have been very disappointed if he had been beaten. It was his first time over the trip and he was still a little bit green when he hit the front, so hopefully he can improve - Kieran Cotter, trainer

runners.name: Josies Kid
runners.comment: Having dropped down the weights he's run well on AW the last twice; a possible
runners.spotlight: Not the force of old and has won just one of his 24 starts, but having dropped down the weights he's run well in this on AW the last twice (5f); sole win came on soft; another headgear change today; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: He could be a real fun horse in good sprint handicaps this year. Last term he managed to beat the useful Korker in a York nursery off 75 and started the new term on career high mark of 86. He finished third at Goodwood on Saturday and he could go to York next week. Groundwise he is a very versatile horse who is more effective on easy ground. 04-05-22

runners.name: Freedom Flyer
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.owner: D Renton And Mrs R Carr

prev_owners.owner: Howard Duff Racing And Mrs R Carr

runners.comment: Looks well treated under penalty for last week's emphatic turf win and Tapeta also suits
runners.spotlight: Denied clear run when second at Southwell on last month's seasonal debut and built on that performance when emphatic winner of 16-runner turf handicap at Thirsk a week ago; still looks well treated under 5lb penalty here and is evidently in prime form.

runners.name: Isle Of Dreams
runners.comment: Won her last three starts last summer and she could have more to offer this year
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (good) last April and landed a summer hat-trick (5f/6f, good/good to firm); this is her first run since and she returns having had a wind op; every chance she'll have more to offer this year and she could play a leading role if okay on the ground (unproven on a slow surface).

quotes.race: Easter Family Day Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: It was only a low-grade race but Isle Of Dream is a nice, genuine filly and she's going the right way. I knew she'd come on for her first run, she was quite green and it was her first run on grass after three on the all-weather. We were expecting a good run - Declan Carroll, trainer.

runners.name: Hot Scoop
runners.comment: Solid C&D form last year and she can go well fresh; firmly in calculations on return
runners.spotlight: Solid C&D form last year, winning in August (good to firm) and going close in September (heavy) and October (soft; when last seen); ran really well on last season's reappearance and she's firmly in calculations today.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Hot Scoop was good and is growing up, but I was glad the rain came. I'd have liked a lead, but he's sensible and picked up well; hopefully he can keep going - Nicola Currie, rider.

runners.name: One Hart
runners.comment: First turf run since October 2021 but some good AW runs this year and could go well
runners.spotlight: Just 1-13 on turf as opposed to 4-36 on AW and this is his first grass run since October 2021; however, he ran some good races on slow ground that autumn and he's posted some positive performances on AW this year (albeit not last time); has a lower turf mark to exploit and could go well.

runners.name: Foreseeable Future
runners.comment: Reappears with yard among the winners but there's a doubt about him on soft ground
runners.spotlight: Makes his reappearance with yard among the winners and he's on a handy mark on the pick of last season's form; however, he was below par when last seen and there's a doubt about him on the forecast soft ground.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: The plan was to take a lead and follow but once Fakhoor came out I had to change plan. I don't think it suited Foreseeable Future making the running but he's got a nice bit of scope to progress and be a nice horse for next year - Luke Morris, jockey.

runners.name: Spanish Angel
runners.owner: Mrs M Chapman, Mrs R Carr, G Shields
runners.comment: AW win two weeks ago and could be bang there if conditions suit (unproven on slow ground)
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent across his last four runs but has won two of them (5f, AW), most recently at Wolverhampton a fortnight ago; also effective on turf and could be bang there if conditions suit (unproven on slow ground).

runners.name: Imperial Khan
runners.comment: Inconsistent 13-race maiden but went close on AW in February and he's not discounted
runners.spotlight: 0-13 and his form can be up and down but he went close at Newcastle (5f, AW) in February and was beaten only two and a half lengths when tenth of 13 there 19 days ago (5f; first run since wind op); ran well on good to soft ground last August (unraced on softer) and he's not discounted.

runners.name: Captain Corcoran
runners.comment: C&D winner who was good fourth of 16 at Thirsk last Tuesday following a break
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with good fourth of 16 behind Freedom Flyer at Thirsk (5f, soft) last Tuesday, when unable to adopt his usual prominent pitch following an awkward start; has won over C&D and can make a bold bid.

quotes.race: www.navanracecourse.ie Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: It was great that he won. He went up a few pounds for being second at the Curragh earlier in the year and it's taken him a while to get back down. He always showed plenty of speed and I'm delighted he's got his head in front. We'll see what the handicapper does but he's in the sales at Goffs and that could be his next assignment - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

runners.name: Birdie Bowers
runners.comment: Creditable fifth of 16 at Thirsk (5f, soft) last Tuesday and he could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Won twice last August (5f, AW/good) and he's been a creditable fifth the last twice, most recently in a big field behind Freedom Flyer at Thirsk (5f, soft) last Tuesday; could be thereabouts.

runners.name: Tommytwohoots
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd

prev_owners.owner: D & S L Tanker Transport Limited

runners.comment: The drop back in trip and outside stall could both be positives; interesting
runners.spotlight: 0-4 on turf (1-25 overall) and his AW form since last November has been predominantly underwhelming; however, he's dropped to a basement mark and showed a bit of spark in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Wolverhampton (6f) a fortnight ago, when shaping as though the drop back to 5f may help; the outside draw could be a big plus today on the slow ground; interesting.

runners.name: Hardy Angel
runners.comment: Best run when runner-up on good ground in August; not so good on softer going next time
runners.spotlight: Best run last season when runner-up at Ripon in August (6f, good), but fared less well on softer ground next time and lacks a recent run.

runners.name: River Usk
runners.comment: Improved in handicaps last term (placed twice over 7f); gelded since; first run on soft
runners.spotlight: Improved when going handicapping last season with a couple of placed efforts over 7f at Leicester (good); gelded since; return to 6f not sure to suit and is having first run on soft.

runners.name: Midnight Flame
runners.comment: Promise over 6f/7f for Tom Ward last season, including on good to soft; interesting
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in testing ground on stable debut at Doncaster last November (6f); had shown promise over 6f and 7f for Tom Ward prior to that, including on good to soft; interesting.

runners.name: Shot
runners.comment: Off the mark with a tongue-tie tried on AW latest; up 4lb; soft ground is a concern
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in a 6f Lingfield AW handicap 12 days ago (first-time tongue-tie); up 4lb and worth considering although is not sure to be suited by today's going, even though her dam won on soft.

runners.name: Monte Forte
runners.comment: Good second on 2022 debut (5f, good) but became rather disappointing; a bit to prove now
runners.spotlight: Good second on his debut at Carlisle last term (5f, good) but became rather disappointing (gelded after second start) and was well beaten on good to soft on final start.

stable_tour.quote: He had always been so professional at home, so it surprised me that he ran green on his debut at Carlisle when second last month. With it being so dry we have not been able to work them on the grass as much as we wanted which has not been a help. He has come out of the race very well and I think he will be a different proposition when he runs at Hamilton on Wednesday. 15-06-22

runners.name: Werenotreallyhere
runners.comment: Promise in 2022, including with headgear; below par in 2023; looks stable's second string
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on several occasions over this trip last season including on good to soft and the AW (blinkers and cheekpieces tried); below par both starts this year (7f last time); cheekpieces back on  but looks the stable second string.

runners.name: Silverlode
runners.comment: Fair efforts on AW on last two starts; a possible back on turf with cheekpieces tried
runners.spotlight: Fair efforts on last two starts, both over 6f at Newcastle; has possibilities back on turf with cheekpieces tried.

runners.name: Tantalus
runners.comment: Best form this year when third over 5f on AW latest; stays 6f but unproven on soft going
runners.spotlight: Showed best form this year when third off this mark over 5f at Newcastle last time, running on and shaping as though a return to 6f would suit; quite interesting but unproven on soft ground.

runners.name: Aurora Glory
runners.owner: Pam Moll, Timothy Ogram & Mike Reay
runners.comment: Good third on handicap debut last term (6f, soft); stable going well; capable of better
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form on handicap debut last season when a length third at Thirsk (6f, soft); stable has made a bright start to the turf season and this one is capable of better.

runners.name: Thornaby Beauty
runners.comment: Runner-up in a strong race at Southwell in Feb; below par next time but could bounce back
runners.spotlight: Showed best form when second at Southwell in February (6f); that was strong form as winner is now rated 15lb higher and third has won since; fared less well in only subsequent start but could bounce back.

7:30.race_name: Unibet 3 Uniboosts Per Day Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Spinaround
runners.comment: Has finished down the field in last four starts and he needs to get back near best
runners.spotlight: Two wins for the Gosdens, the latest at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) last summer; now 2lb lower than for that success but he was out of sorts in his final two runs last season and was down the field again on his stable debut at Newcastle last month; others more persuasive.

quotes.race: Try Our New Super Boosts At Unibet British EBF Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Spinaround had run twice before and is still learning. He's run well today over seven and hit the line well so there should be no problem stepping up to a mile. They got racing early enough, which probably helped us a little bit. He'll probably have one more run and we'll see if he improves for the step up to a mile - Thady Gosden, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Tollard Royal
runners.comment: C&D winner who went close at Beverley in his final run last term; respected on return
runners.spotlight: Has a patchy record but this lightly raced 4yo is a C&D winner and he hit a personal best when a close second at Beverley (7.4f) last September; only 1lb higher on his return and he looks interesting back on Polytrack.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely horse who won over a mile at Kempton last season on his debut and made a pleasing reappearance at Beverley this month when successful over 1m½f. We had him gelded in between, which has been a big help. He's still quite a raw individual out of a mare who improved with time and there is definitely more to come. The Beverley win came off 85 and he is now up to 91, but I think we could have a lot to look forward to with him, possibly a Royal Ascot handicap like the Britannia. He will stay 1m2f in time, so there are plenty of options. 27-04-22

runners.name: Rhythm N Rock
runners.comment: C&D winner but was well held in final three runs last year and has something to prove
runners.spotlight: Dual novice winner including over C&D last March; started his handicap career with a good third at Yarmouth last September but he failed to go on from that in final three runs last year; edging down the weights but he was well held here last time and has something to prove after 145 days off.

runners.name: Darwell Lion
runners.comment: Not at his best in four runs for this yard and he has some questions to answer
runners.spotlight: Forged clear at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) last January in his final run for David O'Meara but he's not hit the same level in four runs for this yard and was out the back over C&D 11 days ago; now only 1lb higher than for last win but he has some questions to answer.

runners.name: Spirit Of The Bay
runners.comment: On workable mark and ran well over C&D on seasonal return last year; one to keep an eye on
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who completed a four-timer in September 2021; no win during a mixed campaign last year but she had some very close calls including off 1lb higher at Sandown; returns from 172 days off but she ran well here on his seasonal return last year and is one to keep an eye on.

stable_tour.quote: Her comeback fourth at Kempton ranks as one of her better performances even though she didn't win. It came in better company and we'll explore a mile and a quarter. She gave her owners heaps of fun last year and she's unexposed over further, which might balance out the fact she's rated higher. 21-04-22

This filly hadawonderfully productive summer last year, winning four on the bounce over a mile, but in so doing saw her mark rise from 63 to 83. I thought she put upacareer-best performance at Ascot last month when a head  second, again over a mile, and she's gone up 3lb to a new high of 86. I always felt she would get further and we'll try that at some point. I'm not too sure where she goes next as she doesn't appreciate the ground being too firm. 09-06-22

runners.name: Hieronymus
runners.comment: His last win was in June 2020 and was last of 13 at Wolverhampton last time
runners.spotlight: Ended 2021 with three good seconds but down the field on last three starts in 2022; both wins have come here (7f/1m) but last success in June 2020.

quotes.race: Unibet Casino Deposit £10 Get £40 Bonus Handicap
quotes.quote: Hieronymus is quite a simple ride and it was just a case of going forward and we've got it very easy in front. We thought he'd stay the mile and he showed a good turn of foot from the front. He keeps galloping and saw it out well. It's great to be back - Nicola Currie, jockey.

runners.name: Fantasy Believer
runners.comment: Triple C&D winner who is on his last winning mark; dangerous back at this track
runners.spotlight: Triple C&D winner who completed a double off this mark at Ascot last July; never involved at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) last month but may have needed the run and has possibilities if he can get back near his best.

stable_tour.quote: He won well at Kempton in April off a mark of 86 and has gone up to 92, but unfortunately that might not be enough to get him into the Royal Hunt Cup. 10-06-21

We bought him off Charlie Hills relatively inexpensively, I thought. He had some really good form and we thought he'd thrown quite a few races away by not jumping out of the stalls. We thought we'd fixed that after his first run but he was back to his old ways on his second run. He's got a quirk but he's a lovely addition to the team and is on a winnable mark - I hope he can be competitive on the grass as well and climb the ladder in handicaps. 19-04-22

runners.name: Cliffs Of Capri
runners.comment: Over three years since his last win and he failed to beat a rival over C&D last time
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is on a dangerous mark but it's been over three years since his last win and he failed to beat a rival over C&D 11 days ago.

quotes.race: 32Red.com Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: I think Cliffs Of Capri will be a better horse on grass. I'm not sure this is his track - Dougie Costello, jockey.

runners.name: Moai
runners.comment: Has struggled in five runs for new yard this year and he needs to turn things around
runners.spotlight: Two turf wins at 1m1f/1m in France and he also ran well in Group 3 events there in 2021; looks very well treated on that form but he's struggled at big prices in five runs for new yard this year and needs to turn things around; hood is removed and cheekpieces are now tried.

runners.name: Arctician
runners.comment: Has won in a hood on Polytrack last twice; respected back up in trip in hat-trick bid
runners.spotlight: Has been resurgent since a hood has been applied and he's won from tough draws here and at Lingfield (both at 7f) in his last two starts; steps back up to 1m but he has form at this trip and still looks on a workable mark; respected in hat-trick bid.

runners.name: Longlai
runners.breeder: Mme Aliette Forien & Mr Gilles Forien
runners.owner: S Hassiakos, M Wigham & David Dixon
runners.comment: Has won when fresh and he needs watching in market back at 1m for new yard
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner (7.4f/1m), who was a creditable third over 1m2f at Newbury in his final run last summer; left Richard Hannon for 25,000gns since; now returns to AW for new yard but he's unexposed in this sphere and his last success was after an absence; needs watching in market.

quotes.race: Westwood Handicap
quotes.quote: Longlai is going the right way. He was gelded in the winter and that's made a difference to him - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

quotes.race: Shadwell Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Longlai is a little bit narrow and weak still, but finished his race off nicely today. I'd like to think he'll be a nice horse for next year. We'll speak to the King Power team and go from there, but he doesn't need to do a lot more this year. He could be a nice mile/mile-and-a-quarter horse for next year - Richard Hannon, trainer.

runners.name: Golden Sands
runners.comment: C&D win on his penultimate run but his form slumped here last time; risks attached
runners.spotlight: Made virtually all over C&D (off 5lb lower) in February but his form slumped here last month when pestered for the lead; is not easy to predict and needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Intercessor
runners.comment: Front-runner who won three times last year; market should be informative on return
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won three times on fast turf last season and he ended 2022 with a good third in the mud at Leicester (1m); has wide draw back on AW after 170 days off but he has won when fresh in the past and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: Fairfax Saddles Grassroots Series Mile Final Handicap
quotes.quote: Intercessor seems to be suited by the mile and he's a very versatile horse considering his size as he is big. He likes it here and we thought he'd run well. He's done nothing but improve all year - John Gallagher, trainer.

7:00.race_name: More Price Boosts Races At Unibet Handicap

runners.name: Gold Aura
runners.comment: Some promise last summer and she's a possible improver upped to 1m on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in three 7f events last summer, including when 8l third of 15 at Newbury (good to firm) on her debut; returns from 229 days off but this step up in trip looks a good move on pedigree and she's a possible improver on handicap debut; one to keep an eye on.

runners.name: King Of Ithaca
runners.owner: Heart Of The South Racing 129 & Partner

runners.name: Starlight Nation
runners.comment: Unexposed handicap newcomer and he needs watching in market on this step up to 1m
runners.spotlight: All three runs have been over 7f here in 2023, including a promising third on his second start; didn't really fire last time but he stayed on from off the pace and shaped as though this step up in trip should suit; yard is in decent form and he needs watching in market on handicap debut.

runners.name: Constitution
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in Polytrack handicaps the last twice and he has plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has failed to beat a rival in Polytrack handicaps (1m/7f) in the last two of his four runs for new yard this year; dropped another 5lb but he's been disappointing since his promising debut second last summer and has plenty to prove.

runners.name: High Court Judge
runners.comment: Polytrack winner in both runs for new yard; respected in bid to make it 3-3 in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Well held in three runs for Johnny Murtagh in Ireland last autumn but he found plenty of progress when dead-heating on his stable/handicap debut at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) in January and followed up with a strong-finishing win over C&D last month; that was a narrow success but a 3lb rise looks fair and he's a big player again in his hat-trick bid.

runners.name: Kitaro Kich
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.owner: J Machale, S Tucker & S Jewell
runners.comment: Improved form upped to 1m on handicap debut when a clear third over C&D; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Finished down the field in first three runs in the autumn but he found improvement upped to 1m on handicap debut when a clear third over C&D two weeks ago; kept on well in that race and he has each-way claims again off unchanged mark.

runners.name: Bingley Crocker
runners.comment: Tailed off in a nursery in final 2yo run and has something to prove on return for new yard
runners.spotlight: Showed clear promise in maiden/novice events for Harry Dunlop last summer and he was tailed off when switched to a nursery at Newbury in his final juvenile run; has been gelded and now goes up in trip for new yard but he has something to prove after 236 days off.

runners.name: Hobson Point
runners.comment: Fair third when upped to 1m at Lingfield but he's now 0-8 and has a patchy profile
runners.spotlight: Fair third when upped to 1m in a Lingfield handicap (Polytrack) last Saturday but that took his record to 0-8 and he has a patchy record so far; has tough draw back at this track and others are more convincing; yard also runs King Of Ithaca.

runners.name: Nibras Rainbow
runners.comment: Dual winner but was held in his final two 2yo runs; has some work to do after 195 days off
runners.spotlight: Won his first two nurseries (7f, turf/Tapeta) but he came up short in fourth at Wolverhampton (9.4f) and Lingfield (7f) in his final two runs last season; unexposed at this trip but he's still 7lb higher than for last win and has some work to do after 195 days off; cheekpieces back on.

runners.name: Roar Emotion
runners.comment: Unexposed handicap debutant but he needs to resume his progress on return
runners.spotlight: Showed promise with his staying-on fourth in a 7f novice here last June but he was well below that form in his final run last season; still unexposed and now goes handicapping back on Polytrack but he needs to resume his progress at this new trip.

runners.name: So Chic
runners.owner: Jj Culhane, C Rosier & G & L Woodward

prev_owners.owner: Jj Culhane, C Rosier & G & L Woodward

runners.comment: Swooped late when scoring at Wolverhampton (7f) and she's only 2lb higher here; dangerous
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 11th attempt when swooping late to land a 7f handicap at Wolverhampton (Tapeta) 18 days ago; this is a deeper race but she's only 2lb higher than last time and could make a serious impact again on this step back up in trip.

runners.name: Zafaan
runners.comment: Still early days but he needs a transformation on his handicap debut
runners.spotlight: No progress when well held in three maiden/novice events, including when upped to 1m at Lingfield (Polytrack; first run since gelded) in February; still early days but he needs a transformation on his handicap debut.

6:30.race_name: More Extra Place Races At Unibet Novice Stakes

runners.name: Quantico
runners.comment: 2-2 and he recorded an RPR of 92 last time; respected under a double penalty on his return
runners.spotlight: Justified strong support on AW in both his runs last year and he recorded an RPR of 92 with his dominant display at Newcastle (1m) in October; has a double penalty after six months off but he's a smart prospect and is strongly respected in his bid to make it 3-3.

runners.name: Yaanaas
runners.comment: Made bright start with his Newcastle (1m) win last month; interesting contender
runners.spotlight: 320,000gns yearling; 6-4 for a Newcastle maiden (1m, Tapeta) last month and he travelled smoothly under a prominent ride before staying on well to score with authority; that striking debut effort puts him firmly in the picture and he's open to improvement.

runners.name: Orzo
runners.comment: Impressive debut win over 7f here in October 2021; market should guide on comeback
runners.spotlight: Well-bred filly who is a half-sister to three very useful winners at up to 1m2f; her sole run was back in October 2021 but that resulted in a 5l win in a 7f novice at this track; recorded a good RPR of 85 in that race and interesting to see how she figures in the market on her comeback.

runners.name: Rayat
runners.comment: Makes his belated debut in a hot race but he needs checking in market
runners.spotlight: 360,000gns yearling; sixth foal; gelded half-brother to winners Kodiak West (Spanish 1m/US 1m1f; RPR 103) and Angel Grey (6f 2yo; 83); dam German 1m winner, out of 6f/7f winning half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Carrizo Creek; makes his belated debut in a hot race but he needs checking in market.

runners.name: Thunder Roar
runners.comment: Placed in both his runs but he has a bit to prove back from another break
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut when runner-up at Salisbury (7f, soft; RPR 87) in September 2021 but he failed to build on that when a well-held third at Nottingham (8.3f, good) last June; gelded since and he has a bit to prove after another break.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice horse and the form of his Salisbury debut worked out very well - he was on the opposite side to the winner there and it would have been a close-run thing if they'd both been together. He's a big horse who's improved for being given a bit of time and turned inside out, he's grown and put on so much weight. We'll find a maiden then step him up and we think an awful lot of him. 10-05-22

runners.name: Poppyequiano
runners.comment: Hood is applied and this looks a daunting task on her belated debut
runners.spotlight: Equiano filly who is out of a modest 1m3f turf winner; hood is applied and this looks a daunting task on her belated debut; best watched.

runners.name: Santiburi Spirit
runners.comment: Finished a tailed-off last at a big price at Lingfield (1m, AW) on her debut in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Finished a tailed-off last at a big price at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) on her belated debut in the autumn.

runners.name: Timeless Melody
runners.comment: Key player on her second here (1m3f) last April; respected on return for new yard
runners.spotlight: Made an encouraging start in a 1m novice at Newcastle last February but she took a major step forward when runner-up here (1m3f, Polytrack) in April; left Godolphin for 65,000gns last summer; now drops back in trip on her return but she has leading claims on her latest form and is a key player on her first run for William Haggas.

5:30.race_name: Unibet Support Safe Gambling/EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Golden Bungle
runners.comment: Yard 0-19 with 2yos last season and she could be a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: £2,500 yearling; fourth foal; dam well held 7f 2yo in France on only start, half-sister to 8.4f winner Purple and French 12.5f/1m5f winner Quel Avantage; looks a longer-term prospect on pedigree.

runners.name: Hot Front
runners.comment: Half-sister to four 2yo winners and dam was a 5f Group 3 juvenile scorer; interesting
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-sister to winners Plunger (5f-7.5f including at 2/AW; RPR 87), Amanda Hug'N'Kiss (5f/7f 2yo winner including AW; 82), Cajmere (5f-6f at 2/GB AW/Greece; 80) and Mokaman (5f including 2yo; 68); dam 5f 2yo winner (including AW/Group 3; 106); plenty to like on paper and yard had 19% record with juveniles last year.

runners.name: Out Of The Stars
runners.breeder: The Out Of The Flames Partnership
runners.comment: Sister to a US 5f 2yo winner and dam was a useful sprinter; needs a close look
runners.spotlight: Second foal; sister to US 5f 2yo winner Stars On Fire; dam 5f-6.5f winner (including GB 2yo/US stakes; RPR 99), closely related to 2m hurdle winner Mutar and half-sister to 5f 2yo Group 3 winner Little Kim; yard has 15% strike-rate with 2yos here in recent years and she's an interesting contender.

runners.name: Shes Smart
runners.comment: Has speed and stamina on her dam's side and others are higher up to list
runners.spotlight: 55,000euros foal, 45,000euros yearling; first foal; dam 6f 2yo AW winner, half-sister to winners Buccellati (1m4f/1m5f Group 3), La Petite Chinosie (Scandinavian 1m4f Listed) and Golden Stud (Italian 5f 2yo Listed); has speed and stamina on dam's side and others are higher up to list.

runners.name: Tiliana
runners.comment: Half-sister to numerous winners but others look more likely types
runners.spotlight: 7,000gns half-sister to 5 winners including Swift Approval (6.5f-7.5f including 2yo/AW/German Listed; RPR 103), Aurora Eclipse (5f 2yo/6f; 91) and Valiant Blue (French/Spanish 5.5f-1m1f); dam placed 13.7f (50) and in 2m1f hurdle, out of 7f 2yo winner; others look more likely types.

runners.name: Tokyo Drift
runners.comment: 52,000gns sister to a 5f AW 2yo winner; market should guide on debut
runners.spotlight: 52,000gns sister to 5f AW 2yo winner Aye Catcher (RPR 66), half-sister to Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner Star Of Lady M (89); dam 7f AW winner (80), half-sister to US stakes-placed 1m/8.3f dirt winner Thelifeoftheparty; yard was 11% with 2yos last year and market should guide on debut.

runners.name: Via Electriano
runners.comment: Others appeal more on paper and she's probably best watched
runners.spotlight: 4,000gns yearling; first foal; dam unplaced 5f-7f (RPR 52), half-sister to winners Vona (5f/6f inc 2yo Listed) and Glan Y Gors (1m2f-1m6f Flat/2m1f jumps); others appeal more on paper and she's probably best watched.

runners.name: Solanna
runners.comment: Triple course winner who is decent form and has possibilities at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick last spring and he returned to winning ways over 1m3f here in January; held on Polytrack and Tapeta in last two runs but was beaten less than 3l on both occasions and has claims if he can find something extra at this new trip.

stable_tour.quote: He got the season off to a fantastic start by winning three races on the bounce, which saw his rating shoot up from 47 to 68. I then made the mistake of giving him time off to strengthen up and I haven't been happy with his last three runs. I expected a big show at Wolverhampton last time but he was mid-division. I've been happy with him at home of late and I think you'll see a different horse next time. 23-09-22

runners.name: Lednikov
runners.comment: Ended last year with two Southwell wins; big player if he can pick up where he left off
runners.spotlight: Awarded a 1m4f handicap at Southwell in November and he backed that up with a brave success there (1m3f) in his final run last year; now makes his Polytrack debut but he's only 1lb higher than last time and is a big player if he can pick up where he left off.

quotes.race: BetUK's Acca Club £5 Free Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a furlong shorter today and Lednikov needed every stride, but Joey gave him a great ride. The horse is very genuine, he gives his best all the time, and he's versatile - Ivan Furtado, trainer.

runners.name: Fight For It

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Hurdle winner but he's 0-7 on the Flat and has something to prove on his return
runners.spotlight: Won a novice hurdle at Ludlow (2m, good) last May but he's generally struggled under both codes since; well treated on his best Flat form but he's 0-7 in this sphere and has something to prove after 128 days off; equipment back on.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken a long time to come to himself this spring but his debut effort over 1m2f at Leicester on Saturday was encouraging and he can develop into a decent handicapper, stepping up to 1m4f in time. 26-04-21

runners.name: Manor Park
runners.comment: Dual purpose-performer who is on a dangerous mark in this sphere; needs watching in market
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat and five-time hurdle winner, who finished a close third in a Huntingdon handicap (2m, good) in his final run last year; his Flat wins have been on turf and last one was in 2021 but he's on a dangerous mark back in this sphere and needs watching in market; cheekpieces removed.

quotes.race: Watch Free Race Replays On attheraces.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Manor Park has lots of ability but he's not an easy horse to train, he's not the soundest horse in the world but he was right today wasn't he - Brian Barr, trainer.

runners.name: Tying The Knot
runners.comment: Disappointing over hurdles last twice and has something to prove on his comeback
runners.spotlight: Won a juvenile hurdle at Hereford (2m, soft) in January but he's been disappointing in both subsequent runs; still relatively lightly raced but he's been well held in his six previous Flat runs and has something to prove back in this sphere; visor is removed and cheekpieces are now tried.

runners.name: Silastar
runners.comment: On last winning mark and ran a promising race over C&D on return last month; interesting
runners.spotlight: Versatile type who defied this mark here (1m) last summer and things didn't go his way when sixth of 12 over C&D (clipped heels and stumbled) last month; that was a promising effort back from a break and he's an interesting contender for in-form yard.

runners.name: Jersey Gift
runners.comment: 0-6 but mark is falling and he shaped as though this return to 1m4f could suit last time
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has finished down the field in three runs since returning from a long absence this year; needs to find more but mark is falling and he shaped as though this drop back in trip could suit at Lingfield (2m, Polytrack) last time.

runners.name: Wheres Tom
runners.comment: On long losing run but has finished runner-up over 1m4f on Polytrack last twice; respected
runners.spotlight: His last win was at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack) in February 2020 but he's reached the frame in his last five runs including runner-up efforts on Polytrack (visor applied) in last two starts; should be in the mix again and he's respected.

quotes.race: Betway Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: I don't think Where's Tom will be going back over hurdles after that, and we might want to go further with him next time. A handicap at Ascot over two miles might suit him - Michael Madgwick, trainer.

runners.name: Iftikhaar
runners.comment: Still lightly raced and mark is tumbling but he needs a major revival
runners.spotlight: Showed some early promise on AW for David Simcock but he flopped in final run for that yard and and was well beaten again on his stable debut at Southwell (1m4f, Tapeta; 80-1) last month; still lightly raced and mark is tumbling but he needs a major revival.

runners.name: Dynakite
runners.comment: Has got back on track since January but he's untried at this trip and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: 5yo who cashed in on a reduced mark here (1m) in January and he went very close at Southwell next time before a fair fourth at Wolverhampton (9.4f) last month; remains well treated on his best form but he's untried at this trip and others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Trojan Truth
runners.comment: 0-9 but he was a good third at Wolverhampton latest and has claims if he can back that up
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent nine-race maiden but he was a creditable third off reduced mark at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) last month; goes back up in trip but he ran well over 11.4f at Windsor last summer and has possibilities if he can repeat that latest form.

runners.name: Devizes
runners.breeder: Sir P Vela, Triermore Stud & New England
runners.comment: Polytrack specialist but he's probably best watched back from a long absence
runners.spotlight: All five wins have been gained over 1m4f on Polytrack and latest was off 1lb lower at Lingfield last January but he was laboured there in his final run last winter; doesn't have a great record when fresh and he's probably best watched after a long absence.

runners.name: Footsy

prev_owners.owner: White Birch Farm And Fittocks Stud

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo but he needs improvement upped to 1m4f on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 4yo but he didn't show much for William Haggas last summer and was beaten 18l when third in a Lingfield novice (1m2f, AW) on his stable debut last month; this is more realistic on handicap debut but he needs improvement on this step up to 1m4f.

runners.name: Hammy End
runners.comment: Infrequent winner who was disappointing last time; risks attached for new yard
runners.spotlight: Won off 1lb higher at Southwell (1m4f, Tapeta) in November but he's not really gone on from that and was disappointing when favourite at Wolverhampton last time; overall record now stands at 3-50 and he comes with risks attached for new yard; cheekpieces removed.

6:00.race_name: Unibet Horserace Betting Operator Of The Year Handicap

runners.name: Topo Chico
runners.comment: Consistent maiden; has possibilities provided she takes well to first-time headgear
runners.spotlight: Consistent maiden who ran creditably (close second) in 7f fillies' handicap at Wolverhampton most recently; now 0-8 but has clear possibilities off unaltered mark provided she takes well to first-time headgear.

runners.name: Captain Wentworth
runners.comment: Peak effort came over 6f; bit to prove back at 7f; third run for new yard
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; has dropped to 6f at Chelmsford for new yard the last twice, running well in November (peak effort) and possibly needing his recent reappearance; bit to prove back over 7f.

runners.name: My Mate Mike
runners.comment: Provided he backs up latest maiden effort, could be involved on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Seemed to run well (66-1 second) over 7f at Lingfield on latest attempt in maidens; provided he confirms that apparent improvement, could be involved on handicap debut.

runners.name: Enborne
runners.comment: Looks open to improvement now handicapping; interesting
runners.spotlight: Weakened into eighth, having made the running, over C&D (back from layoff) on latest novice start; hood (worn on debut) is now reapplied; from a family that has served her owner well, and looks open to improvement in handicaps; interesting.

runners.name: Vasilissa
runners.comment: Return to Polytrack looks a plus; bred to do better still; not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Form dipped on Tapeta ten weeks ago; has consistent form on Polytrack (at Lingfield) and the return to this surface looks a plus; 0-5 but is bred to do better still, being half-sister to a useful filly for her connections; not dismissed.

runners.name: Greavsie
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs L Peacock
runners.comment: Rested 50 days since his busy spell; has won over C&D; could go well
runners.spotlight: Nicely recharged having been rested 50 days since a busy period in January/February that included a C&D win (off 4lb lower); more exposed than some of these rivals but could go well back here.

runners.name: Annie Law
runners.comment: Successful handicap debut over C&D last time; form has worked out well; respected
runners.spotlight: Great start to handicap career in C&D contest 67 days ago, proving suited by the new trip (first attempt beyond 6f); that form has worked out well, with the next three home scoring since; looks the type to improve further; strongly respected.

runners.name: Phoenix Glow
runners.comment: Went very close at Lingfield last week; fighting chance off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in 6f handicap at Chelmsford in February; collared only in the final strides, having made the running, when returned to 7f at Lingfield last week; has a fighting chance off the same mark.

runners.name: River Lyne
runners.comment: May be capable of improvement now qualified for a mark
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability in 7f novice events last term; not obviously well treated on bare form but may be capable of improvement now handicapping at three; market support should be heeded.

runners.name: Billaki Mou
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage D'Yllone
runners.comment: Has something to find with Phoenix Glow on Lingfield running last week
runners.spotlight: Showed some improvement, keeping on for sixth, in similar event at Lingfield (7f) last week when making handicap/seasonal debut; unexposed but has something to find with Phoenix Glow on that form.

3:55.race_name: Barry Hills Further Flight Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Trueshan
runners.comment: Top-class stayer and extremely difficult to see past under his optimum conditions.
runners.spotlight: Right up there in the top tier of the staying division and especially when the mud is flying; made a successful return in this race last season en route to heroically defying top weight in the Northumberland Plate and he signed off with further Group-race honours on Champions Day at Ascot; likely to be extremely hard to beat under his optimum conditions.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: We'd been pretty happy with Trueshan in the last couple of weeks. The ground was right today. The second horse kept battling. He wasn't stopping and he kept coming back at us, so he had to be right up there to hold him off - Alan King, trainer, speaking on ITV Racing.

quotes.race: Coral Doncaster Cup Stakes (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Trueshan was remembering Goodwood. He was frightened to let himself down today, the ground is perfect but he's gone right, he's gone left. It was only in the last furlong that Hollie said he's let himself go. He had a very hard race at Newcastle then we ran him on ground that was quicker than he wants at Goodwood. I think it's left its mark. People have criticised me all the way through about the ground and taking him out but I think you can see why. I've got to speak to the owners but I'd say it's Ascot or nowhere, I'm not going to get him back in two and a half weeks. I hope we get really soft ground, otherwise I might put him away for the winter - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: That's as good a Goodwood Cup as we've seen for a long time. It was a hell of a performance. It was a proper Goodwood Cup and I think it's fair to say Trueshan is very good, but not at his absolute best on that ground. I was happy to run him and I've no regrets about running him, but we know he's better on soft ground - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Northumberland Plate Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: It was an extraordinary win. Hollie told us exactly how she was going to ride Trueshan and she did it. We just tell her to get on with it and she does it. It's well documented we were running because we couldn't run at Ascot, we are aiming for the Goodwood Cup and we needed a run. This was the safest place to run - Alan Marsh, owner.

quotes.race: Barry Hills Further Flight Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It was really straightforward, Trueshan got into a nice rhythm and the further he went the better. It was a great starting point. He's strengthened up really nicely and it doesn't feel like five minutes ago we were winning around Ascot. Today wasn't D-day but I was really happy with him. He's done so well physically and I don't see why he can't be even better this year. Hollie Doyle, jockey

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: I was more nervous today because of the fact it had only been two weeks since Longchamp. Trueshan was quite a handful to saddle and quite hot. I don't think he was at his best but I think we got away with it today, but only just. He had to be very brave today - the runner-up kept coming back at us and I thought Stradivarius ran a great race. Let's hope we get a wet Royal Ascot next year as it would be lovely to run him in the Gold Cup - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Al Shaqab Goodwood Cup Stakes (Group 1) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: Trueshan is a superstar on this ground. We weren't going very quick early on and he was a little keen but I just let him slide up on to the girth of the leader and he took up the bridle on me. The further he went the better and he found another gear - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: tote+ Pays You More At tote.co.uk Ormonde Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled to bits with Trueshan. It's been worrying me that he's been ready to run for the last three or four weeks - we were going to go to Nottingham and then Ascot and I wasn't sure I could hang on to him for much longer. It was lovely to get a run into him and I was thrilled with the way he's run. It's a good start. I was actually fairly relaxed today because it was a prep and it was a big ask given weight away - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Qipco British Champions Long Distance Cup (Group 2) (British Champions Series)
quotes.quote: It's unbelievable. Obviously we'd hoped Trueshan would run well but we weren't expecting something like that. You couldn't expect that, but obviously the step up in trip suited him and we know he does handle that ground. Win or lose it was always going to be his last run of the season. We'll put him away for the winter now and look forward to next summer and the Cup races. - Alan King, trainer

quotes.race: British European Breeders' Fund Conditions Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: I thought we were in trouble when Hamish loomed upsides but he battled really well. He has schooled but he is not going jumping. He is going to have his winter holiday now. He's done enough. I am thrilled with him. They are two good horses. He wouldn't want fast ground and I thought he was floundering a bit on that today. Good or good to soft would be ideal. We will work back from the Ebor which would be a mid-season target for him next year - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Old Rowley Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Trueshan was going to go jumping but he may stay on the Flat after that. William (Buick) said he could be an Ebor horse -  Colin McKenzie, part-owner.

runners.name: Buzz
runners.owner: Thurloe For Royal Marsden Cancer Charity
runners.comment: Very smart dual-purpose performer but off since 2021 and these terms are tough.
runners.spotlight: Absent since 2021 when he was going great guns, following his second in the Grade 1 2m4f Aintree Hurdle with victories in the Cesarewitch and a Grade 2 hurdle at Ascot; remains to be seen if he's still at that level but, even then, he'll do well to beat the best of these.

quotes.race: Coral Hurdle (Registered As The Ascot Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Buzz will come back here for the Long Walk Hurdle before Christmas and we'll find out about three miles. I wanted to start at two and a half and he travelled and jumped so well, but you would not want to come back down in distance. The softer the ground the better - that was the only worry today, was it soft enough. There's no point coming back to two miles and there's nothing at two and a half so we'll try three. It's some journey, he was rated 130-something at the start of last season - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Together For Racing International Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Buzz is a proper horse. There is the Long Distance Hurdle at Newbury, the race at Wetherby, the West Yorkshire Hurdle. He is very relaxed now and he doesn't get as fizzed up as he used to. Nicky's horses are flying and I was confident when it was good to soft early in the week. He has got all the big targets for him hurdling this season. He was turned out and came back with this race in mind and he was well in. He is a proper Grade One/Two level hurdler. On the back of the Aintree Hurdle effort we have to work back from the Stayers' Hurdle - Jess Stafford, spokeswoman for owners Thurloe Thoroughbreds.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Handicap
quotes.quote: Buzz is hard work and it's credit to the team at home. He's not unmanageable, but he's just impatient. He got outpaced a couple of furlongs out and just stayed on, but we've been waiting for this ground. He could be a November Handicap horse. I hoped he'd be an Ebor horse, but he might have too much speed in his pedigree - Hughie Morrison, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good form. He's going well but I'm not going to get a run into him before Cheltenham. That should be a worry but he's a peculiar horse and we got him ready for the Cesarewitch after a layoff. Reggie [Pallas] rides him every day and was thrilled with him on Saturday. He's in really good nick and has schooled but it was a horrible injury he suffered. That's not to say it's impossible [running at Cheltenham]. He'd have to have a racecourse gallop first and I'd like to do that on grass if I could, but it's been a remarkable recovery because there are fractured pelvises and then there was this; it was horrible. It's been a long journey back and he's still very lopsided, but he moved beautifully the other day and it's had no effect on his schooling. Aintree might make more sense, but you never know. We won't do it unless he's 100 per cent, but we were planning on this before he went wrong in December 2021 and you'd think he'd stay three miles. 13-2-23

runners.name: Mojo Star
runners.comment: Ascot Gold Cup second and might well give Trueshan a race in receipt of 7lb.
runners.spotlight: Only won a maiden but has high-profile placed form, finishing runner-up in both the Derby and St Leger as a 3yo and on his only sighting last season pushing the mighty Kyprios close in the Ascot Gold Cup; might well give Trueshan a race in receipt of 7lb, provided he's ready to rock after 300 days away; seems fine on all ground.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I travelled super into the straight. This lad over 1m4f just seems to always lack half a gear, but you don't want to light him up and make too much use of him. I think Mojo Star is going be a top horse at two miles next year - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

quotes.race: Academy Insurance British EBF Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Mojo Star is not the sort of horse who will go 20l clear ever, but that's a nice gallop and it'll put him right for the St Leger, which I've always thought was his race. When he got stopped in the Irish Derby, it took him a while to get going again and that's why I think the extra two furlongs will suit him. You wouldn't see a nicer looking horse and he's different class to anything we've had over this trip for a long, long time. This track suits him and Doncaster will as well. He's fast enough for a mile and a half but there are not many horses who can keep that gallop going for as long as he can. He'd love to get his toe in - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Cazoo Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (Entire Colts & Fillies)
quotes.quote: Mojo Star has always been the most gorgeous horse we've had at our place for a long time. He travelled like a really good horse. He didn't handle the undulations, and we've got enough money now to throw at some fancy entries - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was narrowly beaten at Newbury last season and has grown into a massive, strong, good-looking three-year-old. Hopefully he's a good horse but only time will tell. He'll probably start off in a mile-and-a-quarter maiden. We're going to give him a bit of time and go to Newbury. He was entered in the Derby at the second entry stage 16-04-21

runners.name: Rajinsky
runners.comment: A useful stayer but everything points towards limitations in this company.
runners.spotlight: Won the 2m2f Cesarewitch Trial at Newmarket last September but he was then tailed off in his first Group-race assignment at Longchamp (1m7f, heavy); everything points towards limitations in this company.

quotes.race: Turners Cesarewitch Trial Handicap
quotes.quote: Harry has ridden Rajinsky well on ground that was probably on the quick side for him. I'm delighted with the way he has improved all year, though it has been frustrating as he has only been limited to four runs. I just felt if the ground came right we should have a look at this, and if we do go for the Cesarewitch I felt we needed to have a run beforehand -  Hugo Palmer, trainer.

quotes.race: tote+ Chester Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Rajinsky ran a cracker and if the split had come at the right time, he could have won. It was another career best and all those staying races are there, so long as it's not firm ground. Harry [Davies] said he couldn't pull him up and he'll stay further and he could go for the Queen Alexandra at Royal Ascot - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

quotes.race: 25 Years Since Frankie's Magnificent Seven Handicap
quotes.quote: I was caught on the wing the whole way but Tom [Dascombe] was confident Rajinsky was in good form. It's worked out well. He's very consistent and liked the ground - Pierre-Louis Jamin, jockey.

quotes.race: Visit attheraces.com Handicap
quotes.quote: I'd dearly love to have a runner in the Chester Cup with a chance but I think somewhere like York would suit Rajinksy a lot better. I haven't spoken to the owner but I'd be thinking of maybe another week's time. But we'll see and if we want to have a runner we've got one now - Tom Dascombe, trainer.

quotes.race: Windsor's Greatest Show Fireworks Extravaganza Handicap
quotes.quote: Rajinsky damaged a tendon in his leg and Tom Dascombe said it would take a year but he's a good horse and was worth the wait. You've got to be patient but you've got to have confidence in your trainer - Raj Matharu, owner.

quotes.race: Bet & Watch At 188bet.co.uk EBF Maiden Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rajinsky got lost first time out and didn't know what was happening, but he's progressed with every run. He finished behind what looks a nice horse last time, when the penny was dropping all the way. Walkinthesand responded as we got there, but the more we were going there more he was learning and going the right way. I think a mile will be his bag, but he's next year's horse. It's onwards and upwards - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He produced a career best at Ripon, then ran a mighty race in the Chester Cup when if he'd been able to get out earlier he might have given the winner something to think about. The Ascot Stakes is the perfect race for him but he was put up to 101, which means he'll be the first one to be eliminated. He's got course form but he doesn't want the ground much faster than good. 08-06-22

He did well with a nice win over 2m last year at Ascot and quickly picked up where he left off with a win at Ripon first time out for me in April. He ran a stormer when third to Cleveland in the Chester Cup and fourth in the Northumberland Plate was a good effort, although I can't help feeling he ran slightly below his best. He had a wide draw, which I was happy with, but then you must get in. He'll get an Ebor entry and also in the Cesarewitch. He wants a little give in the ground, so we'll see what happens. 06-07-22

runners.name: Tashkhan
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: More likely to be placed in this than win, but should give backers a run for their money.
