runners.spotlight: On similar terms he got to within 2l of Trueshan on Champions Day at Ascot in 2021; winless last season but ran some good races, notably finishing a 5l fifth in the Ascot Gold Cup; more likely to be placed in this than win, but should give backers a run for their money.

quotes.race: Qatar Prix du Cadran (Group 1) (4yo+) (New & Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Ben (Robinson) just said that having run four times on fast ground, Tashkan didn't know whether he was just thinking about that (early on). He said once he got his confidence he raced a bit better. But the winner's a machine isn't he? Just a different ballgame. This is just a cheap horse and he never lets me down. We might go to Ascot and if not we'll come back here for the Royal-Oak, I think that will be more likely - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Tashkhan is very exciting and there are lots of options now. The soft ground is key to him, he wants a bit of cut and it really makes a difference. He's entered in the John Smith's Cup but with his three-year-old weight-for-age allowance, he won't get in. There's the Melrose at York and he could run against the older horses. The two-mile races could be an option as he stayed well there-Patrick Boyle, owner

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: I would say getting gelded has made a big difference to Tashkan and he definitely has his mind more on the job. You could see that Ross was rowing away on him a long way out but he just kept galloping. Down the line I can see him making into a nice three-year-old hurdler - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's in great form and we're just hoping for a bit of rain. He's run two good races this year, considering the ground hasn't been right for him. He loved the softer ground when he was second to Trueshan there last season and two and a half miles is tailor-made for him; all he does is stay. 08-06-22

runners.name: Urban Artist
runners.comment: Has a decent record when fresh and she'll go on the ground, but likely to be outclassed.
runners.spotlight: Posted career-best form when runner-up in a 1m6f Group 2 for fillies at Glorious Goodwood last summer before signing off with a poor one; has a decent record when fresh and she'll go on the ground, but looks outclassed.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Best Odds Guaranteed Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm sure Urban Artist would be very good over hurdles but I think we'll keep her to the Flat. I'll await my instructions but she's decent. There's not a lot of her but there is plenty in there and she's very easy to get fit. She's progressive, she obviously liked the ground and she stays. This might be the highest she goes but she's alright - Hughie Morrison, trainer.

quotes.race: Karndean Designflooring Mares' Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I am really happy with Urban Artist. She has come on a load since Ludlow. Hughie [Morrison] has done a great job with her in freshening her up. I am really happy with that - Nico De Boinville, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She hasn't won for a while but has run some very good races without getting the rub of the green. I felt she was desperately unlucky not to win the Bronte Cup in the stewards' room on her seasonal debut after the winner should have been disqualified for dangerous riding in my opinion. Urban Artist ran a good race last time behind Stratum at Royal Ascot and has an entry for the Lillie Langtry Stakes at Goodwood this month. 13-07-22

runners.name: Typewriter
runners.comment: Best form was her third in last season's Cheshire Oaks at Chester; this demands more.
runners.spotlight: Best form was her third in last season's Cheshire Oaks at Chester (11.3f, soft); even a repeat of that will see her come up short at this level.

runners.name: Tajalla
runners.comment: Not seen since winning at last year's Craven meeting; undoubtedly promising.
runners.spotlight: Looked very smart when justifying favouritism in a good-ground novice at Newmarket's Craven meeting last April and was bound for the Norfolk at Royal Ascot until injury intervened; returns from a year out with a big weight on soft ground and might be best watched.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he was going to win the Norfolk last year but he picked up a fracture that ended his campaign. He's starting to work well and could go to Nottingham next Wednesday for a 5f novice. He's not big and I hope we haven't missed the boat with him, but hopefully his size won't hold him back. 06-04-23

He made an impressive start to his career at the Craven meeting. He looked very nice that day but unfortunately he had a setback and has not run since. He is most unlikely to run again until the autumn/winter, but I like him. 17-08-22

runners.name: Eternal Class
runners.comment: Had winners behind when scoring at Thirsk; second run was too bad to be true.
runners.spotlight: 270,000euros yearling; had subsequent winners behind when making a successful debut at Thirsk (5f, good to soft) and presumably failed to give her true running when only fifth when odds-on at Southwell in August; could yet prove herself to be above average.

quotes.race: JW 4x4 Northallerton EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very nice, I was happy with that. Eternal Class was well backed by somebody, I don't gamble so it's not my money. We fancied her a little bit but it looked quite a hot race on paper. She did it really well. There's not a lot of her so we'll mind her. Danny said she was very quick and very professional. We'll see how she comes out of the race and let Karl decide what we do with her. She has an entry in the Lowther but we might have something better for that in Dramatised! - Steve Parkin, owner.

runners.name: Fair Wind
runners.comment: Has to step up on last week's debut form here but he should be all the wiser.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to four winning sprinters; also hooded here last week and after taking a while to settle he finished an encouraging third behind horses who had the benefit of experience (Sera Dawn runner-up); has to step up plenty on that form but he should be all the wiser.

runners.name: Mccauleys Tavern
runners.comment: Useful form in defeat when trained in Ireland; plenty to like about his Kempton return.
runners.spotlight: 0-8 last year for Fozzy Stack but he showed plenty of ability (including on testing ground) and was recruited by his shrewd new connections for 62,000gns; showed up well for a long way at Kempton (6f) and his market drift suggested that the run would be needed; dropping back to 5f under these conditions might well benefit him.

runners.name: Zeno
runners.comment: Missed the kick and then raced green when fifth of 11 runners at Wolverhampton (6f).
runners.spotlight: Missed the kick and then raced green when fifth of 11 runners at Wolverhampton (6f); entitled to be a lot wiser this time but will need to be.

runners.name: Sera Dawn
runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Rallied for second here last week but she's thrown into a much better race this time.
runners.spotlight: Highest RPR last season of 67 came on soft ground; raised that to 70 when a rallying second here last week (good to soft) but thrown into a much better race this time.

runners.name: Stocks Park
runners.comment: Not far away when fourth at Chelmsford but then only seventh at Wolverhampton.
runners.spotlight: Not far away when fourth at Chelmsford but then only seventh at Wolverhampton; this looks a big ask on turf debut.

2:20.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap

runners.name: Latin Verse
runners.comment: Won his maiden over 1m4f but dropping back to 1m2f should be no hardship.
runners.spotlight: Looks nicely progressive after winning his maiden at Lingfield (1m4f AW) with a bit in hand and that was probably a decent race; no surprise if he proves this initial mark to be on the lenient side and dropping back to 1m2f should be no hardship; turf debut.

runners.name: Bohemian Breeze
runners.comment: Just the type to pay his way in handicaps for a yard in good early-season form.
runners.spotlight: Galileo colt; similar sort of form in three qualifying runs at about 1m and looks just the type to pay his way in handicaps for a yard in good early-season form.

runners.name: Mudskipper
runners.comment: Ideally suited by soft at two; longer trip the right move now sent into handicaps.
runners.spotlight: Perhaps unsuited by the fast ground on debut as he showed plenty more in his two later runs on soft, particularly when second to a Godolphin horse at Goodwood (1m); this step up in trip is an obvious move now into handicaps and could go well.

runners.name: Kadovar
runners.comment: Ran no race at Doncaster and a big ask to bounce back only ten days later.
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a soft-ground maiden over 1m here in October so those conditions were not the obvious answer to his disappointing return at Doncaster when made one of the favourites for a 1m2f handicap; big ask to bounce back only ten days later.

runners.name: Dawn Vega
runners.comment: 0-5 but looks a winner waiting to happen and sent over further this time.
runners.spotlight: Gelded after four defeats last season when progressive; failed to justify favouritism on his return at Chelmsford (1m AW) but it was by no means a bad run and both this surface and the longer trip could benefit.

runners.name: Eyetrap
runners.comment: Promise at two; has a middle-distance pedigree and should do well in handicaps.
runners.spotlight: Debut was at Newmarket and his saddle slipped next time out, then he took a sizeable step forward to make the frame at Kempton (1m); has a middle-distance pedigree and should do well in handicaps.

2:50.race_name: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap

runners.name: Betweenthesticks
runners.comment: Kept busy as a 2yo with 15 starts; perhaps vulnerable to improvers off her current mark.
runners.spotlight: Kept busy as a 2yo with 15 starts; Rose Dawes was aboard when edging home in a York sprint nursery (5lb lower) and the below-par run that followed was only five days later; perhaps vulnerable to improvers off her current mark.

runners.name: Thankuappreciate
runners.owner: Ms Sara Hattersley And Miss Tracey Mann
runners.comment: Solid first season and very nearly defied a penalty the final time; respected.
runners.spotlight: Nicely progressive in his five starts last season, going close to defying a penalty the final time at Redcar (5f, good to soft); trainer a dab hand in bringing along sprinters; respected.

quotes.race: Titanium Racing Club EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Horses In Band D) (EBF Restricted Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: That was brilliant. The steering wheel seemed to fall off Thankuappreicate last time and he couldn't be got under control, but he was straightforward today. I don't know what the level of that form is, but you couldn't ask for more than what he did today - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was unlucky not to win at Ayr last time. He didn't get the best of passages and had to be switched, and he couldn't quite quicken up for that level of experience. We've got to run him once more to get a handicap mark for nurseries. I'm sure he'll win races. 27-07-22

runners.name: Paddys Day
runners.comment: Beat a serial loser on the AW last time; up 3lb and ground this soft will be a first.
runners.spotlight: Beaten seven times after his debut success over 6f, and when returning to winning ways at Lingfield (5f AW) he beat a frustrating 3yo who made it 0-16 when only mid-division at Southwell on Sunday; a 3lb rise may find him out in this better race and ground this soft will be a first.

stable_tour.quote: A winner at Windsor on his debut, he's come out of that race really well and is an uncomplicated horse who should be suited by six furlongs at Ascot. It won't be easy but he's always gone very well and takes everything in his stride. 09-06-22

runners.name: Absolutelyflawless
runners.comment: Last season started well but rather petered out; bit to prove on her return off this mark.
runners.spotlight: Won his first two last season, a novice at Southwell and the Lily Agnes at Chester's May meeting (both 5f; latterly good to soft); her campaign rather petered out afterwards and she'll need to be right back on song to defy this mark.

quotes.race: ICM Stellar Sports Lily Agnes Conditions Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Absolutelyflawless is very tough and will give you everything but she'll make you work for it. Today was the plan and Royal Ascot will go on the table now and we'll see what we think. But she's got a lot of speed, she settles and travels and with the stiff five furlongs at Ascot, I wouldn't be afraid of going there - David Loughnane, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's the third winning progeny of the dam, which includes the Flying Childers winner Beacon. Absolutelyflawless had shown some nice speed at home before her debut at Southwell last month and I expected a good run. She won despite being very green and improved for that experience, so much so that I ran her in the Lily Agnes Stakes at Chester last week and she came through with a strong run to win by a length and a half. She can be a bit of a madam but there's no questioning how genuine she is. Chester was the big plan and we managed to pull that off, so now we'll sit down and talk to his owners about where we go next, but Royal Ascot will be seriously considered as the stiff 5f there would be right up her street. 11-05-22

runners.name: Fix You
runners.comment: Soft-ground winner at two; ran an excellent race at the weights on her AW comeback.
runners.spotlight: Looked very at home on the soft ground when bolting up on her Thirsk debut last April (5f) and then finished fourth of five runners in a French Listed race the following month; her third run was a good while coming but she only narrowly failed to beat an Andrew Balding gelding, who received weight, at Kempton (6f) 11 days ago; respected.

stable_tour.quote: It is always nice to get an early juvenile winner as you get an idea of where you stand with the two-year-olds in the yard, so her impressive win at Thirsk last month gave us a real boost. She has come out of that experience well and the plan is to go for the Marygate at York next week. Obviously, we have the Queen Mary as a possible option, but I am thinking more of one of the big sales races towards the end of the year, which could be the better option. 04-05-22

runners.name: Desperate Hero
runners.breeder: P Taplin & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Looks on a competitive mark for h'cap debut and his sire was capable on soft ground.
runners.spotlight: Consistent form in his five starts last season (5f-6f; maiden/novices), signing off with a clearcut odds-on success at Chepstow (6f, good to firm); looks on the right sort of mark for his handicap debut but still considered, and his sire was very capable on soft ground.

runners.name: Castan
runners.comment: Form figures of 132212 in nurseries and has shown he can live with this sort of mark.
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 132212 in nurseries and good to soft (unraced on softer) was fine when winning off 8lb lower at Catterick; showed that he can deal with this sort of mark when runner-up on his AW debut; hard to dismiss.

quotes.race: Start Racing TV Free Trial Now Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Castan did it nicely and Kevin never hit him. He said all day long that Castan would win these types of races and I'm delighted for the owners - Bryan Smart, trainer.

runners.name: Open Market
runners.comment: Hasn't gone on from her Cork success; perhaps the hood will help her settle better.
runners.spotlight: Exuberant filly who won at Cork (5f, yielding to soft) last season but has disappointed in her two runs since (good to firm/AW); no sign of her settling down when beaten 7l on her stable debut at Wolverhampton but perhaps the hood will help in that respect.

runners.name: On The Pulse
runners.comment: Dual nursery winner who can cope with this mark; stepping up to 1m may well suit her.
runners.spotlight: Won two of her first three nurseries (one on soft) and wasn't far away in another at Newmarket (7f) on her penultimate start; stepping up 1m is unlikely to present a problem.

runners.name: Class Member
runners.comment: Beaten in four novice events on the AW and her best run was the second; cheekpieces new.
runners.spotlight: Beaten in four novice events on the AW and her best run was the second when going close at Southwell (6f); didn't finish with any purpose returned to 7f the last time and cheekpieces are turned to for handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely filly owned by Clipper Logistics, and although she has not worked yet I like the look of her. For such a fine daughter of Charm Spirit she was a relatively inexpensive purchase. She is starting to look the part now. If it had been last year, we'd have had her worked and ready to go, but we're able to give them more time now. 27-04-22

runners.name: Eurythmical
runners.comment: Excuses when made favourite for her handicap debut; sports cheekpieces this time.
runners.spotlight: Positives to take from her qualifying runs (6f) and when made favourite for handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f) she hung left throughout and found trouble in running; cheekpieces could make a difference this time.

runners.name: Zebra Star
runners.comment: Nursery winner last season; balance of form suggests this mark might be on the high side.
runners.spotlight: Won a Yarmouth nursery (7f, good to soft) in these colours last season for George Boughey but well held afterwards over that same trip at Newmarket (Class 2) and Haydock (Class 5); balance of form suggests this mark might be on the high side.

quotes.race: Racing League On Sky Sports Racing Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Soft ground is the key to Zebra Star and she loved it out there. Hopefully she'll have a productive autumn and also has the scope for next year - George Boughey, trainer.

runners.name: Molly Valentine
runners.comment: Twice well held in handicaps (6f/7f) since winning a 6f maiden for fillies on the AW.
runners.spotlight: Twice well held in handicaps (6f/7f) since winning a 6f maiden for fillies on the AW; not wildly appealing over this longer trip on softer ground.

runners.name: Ravigill
runners.comment: Stayed on steadily to make the frame on handicap debut over C&D (soft) last autumn.
runners.spotlight: Ran her best race of last year on her nursery debut over C&D (soft) when staying on steadily from off the pace; returns off only 1lb higher.

runners.name: Bonkersinabundance
runners.comment: Goes up in trip on new ground and probably off a tough enough mark.
runners.spotlight: Went close on her Brighton debut (7f, good to soft) but didn't really make any further progress afterwards and she shied away from nurseries; goes up in trip on new ground and probably off a tough enough mark.

runners.name: Anieres Girl
runners.comment: Lightly raced but had a long time out and she's unproven under these conditions.
runners.spotlight: First three runs at 6f and clearly improved for going over Beverley's extended 7f when snatching third on her final run in July; had a long time out and she's unproven under these conditions.

runners.name: Bletchley Storm
runners.comment: Not that competitive in three novice events on the AW; should improve for going 1m.
runners.spotlight: Not that competitive in three novice events on the AW (7f, then twice at 6f); pedigree points towards improvement over this longer trip, so that's something.

1:50.race_name: Bet At racingtv.com Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Exoplanet
runners.comment: Novice winner who then struggle in a Group 3; retains Group-race entries.
runners.spotlight: Tracked leaders and produced over 1f out in 15-runner novice at Newbury (7f, good), prevailing by a neck; later finished last in the Group 3 1m Autumn Stakes at Newmarket (good); retains plenty of potential as a 3yo and he has Group entries; trainer was complimentary in his recent Stable Tour interview.

quotes.race: Racing TV EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Exoplanet is lovely. The plan was always to come here and get him started. He's a nice horse that has looked the part at home, especially in the past couple of weeks when the recent rain helped us get him onto the grass. He's strengthened into his frame over the last two or three weeks and I thought David gave him a lovely ride. He moved through the race nicely and finished well under pressure. He could be put away now, but we will see - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was no surprise when he won on his debut and I think he's a really nice horse. I don't know why he ran so badly in the Autumn Stakes but he just wasn't himself. He looks the part, works well and I wouldn't lose faith. 06-04-23

runners.name: Overactive
runners.comment: Encouraging runs on the AW; well-bred filly who is entitled to make a better 3yo.
runners.spotlight: Came up short on two visits to Wolverhampton (7f/8.6f) but both efforts were encouraging and she's a well-bred filly who is entitled to make a better 3yo.

runners.name: Playactor
runners.comment: Badly in need of the experience at Lingfield but this looks a stronger contest.
runners.spotlight: Only seventh of 12 at Lingfield 18 days ago (1m AW) but a slow start didn't help matters and he looked badly in need of the experience; should step up on that but probably up against it nonetheless.

runners.name: Sir Raj
runners.comment: Half-brother to useful Flat stayer Rajinsky and dual 1m2f winner Bahkit.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to useful Flat stayer Rajinsky and dual 1m2f winner Bahkit; lack of experience may hold him back on this soft-ground debut.

runners.name: Torito
runners.comment: Shaped with considerable promise at Newbury and improvement is on the cards.
runners.spotlight: Kingman half-brother to several winners for these connections and holds a Derby entry; shaped with considerable promise when a beaten favourite at Newbury (1m, soft) and an interesting contender with improvement on the cards.

runners.name: Aussi Mandate
runners.comment: Lost lengths at the start and also finished lame when tailed off at Goodwood in August.
runners.spotlight: 60,000gns yearling related to useful winners; lost many lengths at the start and also finished lame when tailed off over 1m at Goodwood in August (good to soft; 28-1); best watched.

runners.name: Riffa Fort
runners.comment: Beat only one home on his handicap debut over 1m2f on the AW.
runners.spotlight: Best run was his debut when fifth in a 1m4f maiden at Doncaster (good to firm); beat only one home on his handicap debut over 1m2f on the AW.

runners.name: Mabre
runners.comment: Unlucky on the AW last time; effective on turf and handles this sort of ground.
runners.spotlight: Comes here after some good runs on the AW and looked unlucky last time at Lingfield (1m); as effective on turf and handles this sort of ground.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud Partners Of The AWC Handicap
quotes.quote: Mabre had posted a couple of below-par efforts and I was worried that there was no pace on early but I got a nice tow into the race off the second in the straight - Darragh Keenan, jockey.

runners.name: Eleven Eleven
runners.comment: Dual AW winner who went down narrowly over 1m at Newcastle a month ago; turf debut.
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who went down narrowly over 1m at Newcastle a month ago; only 1lb higher for this but having her first run on turf.

runners.name: Antagonize
runners.comment: Two poor runs since going close at Carlisle in September; thoroughly exposed.
runners.spotlight: Just missed out at Carlisle (1m Class 6, good to soft) in September but poor next time and again on reappearance; thoroughly exposed (4-30).

quotes.race: Skybet Britains Most Popular Online Bookmaker EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Antagonize is such a big lad, he's still very green but he has so much talent. I know Bryan Smart thinks the world of him and Graham Lee was very impressed - Mike Bullock, owner/breeder.

quotes.race: Stobart Aviation Services Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: We are all excited about Antagonize, we've always liked him. We'll go quietly away with him, there's no rush. Once he knows his job, he could be anything. I think he'll get a mile, and if he does he could be exceptional - Bryan Smart, trainer.

runners.name: More Diamonds
runners.comment: Best run came on soft ground in 2021 and not had those conditions since.
runners.spotlight: Finished close up in a soft-ground 7f novice at Newmarket in 2021 which is just about her best piece of form; hasn't had that ground since so could leave her handicap form behind; sold out of Richard Hughes's yard for 4,000gns since last run; interesting.

runners.name: Big Bear Hug
runners.comment: Trip/ground fine but wasn't exactly in flying form when last seen.
runners.spotlight: Best efforts have been from 1m-1m2f on good ground or slower; wasn't exactly in flying form when last seen, though.

runners.name: Confils
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Mandore
runners.comment: Seen only once last year and didn't run that well on her reappearance.
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner on turf but not since September 2021; seen only once last year and didn't run that well on her reappearance.

runners.name: Nine Elms

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Pressed the pace throughout when third on the AW last time; soft ground a worry.
runners.spotlight: Exposed but a five-time winner and ran well to make the frame at Southwell (1m) last time after pressing the pace throughout; not sure these conditions will suit him ideally.

quotes.race: Southwell Racecourse Supports visitsouthwell.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: Nine Elms showed a bit at Leicester, then the ground was a bit quick for him at Haydock and the distance stretched him last time. The drop back in trip suited him, he picked up the bridle halfway round the final bend and did it nicely. You're guaranteed a strong pace around here and that suited him as he had something to aim at - Lewis Edmunds, jockey.

runners.name: Recorwoman
runners.comment: One decent run on the AW this winter (1m) and might be happier back on turf.
runners.spotlight: Won on very soft ground in France (7f; 1-22 overall); one decent run on the AW this winter (1m) and might be happier back on turf.

runners.name: Distinction

prev_owners.owner: Nick Willis And Mike And Wendy Yardley

runners.comment: Decent form for this grade over 1m on softish ground but signed off last year below par.
runners.spotlight: Has decent form for this grade over 1m on softish ground but signed off last year below par; bit to prove.

runners.name: Buachaill
runners.comment: Opposable on handicap form and the AW is perhaps more his scene.
runners.spotlight: Gained first win when prevailing in a classified race at Wolverhampton (8.6f) and placed in another there next time; opposable on handicap form and the AW is perhaps more his scene.

2:30.race_name: Jigsaw Sports Branding Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Since Day One
runners.comment: Didn't seem to stay 2m5f+ latest and every chance on earlier 2m form
runners.spotlight: Beaten in a match latest, when not appearing to stay 2m5f+; won twice earlier in the season and only 1lb higher than for the second of those; soft ground suits and every chance of another success; often leads.

stable_tour.quote: Another very consistent horse who won four of his six hurdles outings before going chasing this season, and he has done well with two wins from four. He beat Tommy's Oscar on his penultimate start at Newcastle in a novice handicap chase before finishing third to that same rival on 19lbs worse terms in the Grade 3 Lightning Novices' Chase at Doncaster late last month. He is not really a Graded horse but the options were limited so we went there and he picked up some nice place money in the process. Looking to the future we will step him up to 2m4f and possibly further in time. He is a grand horse and will definitely win more races. 09-02-23

runners.name: In Excelsis Deo
runners.comment: Good winner on British/chasing debut; two modest efforts since; may do better back in trip
runners.spotlight: Impressed on British/chasing debut at Hereford four months ago but hasn't matched that in two outings since, both at around 2m4f; may be happier back at this trip but does have something to prove for now.

runners.name: Thelasthighking
runners.comment: Two chase runs and won well at Wincanton in the second; up 8lb; live contender
runners.spotlight: No match for the winner when second on chasing debut but put that experience to good use with an emphatic Wincanton success 16 days ago; up 8lb but looks capable of progressing as a chaser; stays 2m4f but didn't look taxed for pace in the win.

runners.name: Quid Pro Quo
runners.comment: Pulled up in both chases; likely to do better but deal to prove for now
runners.spotlight: Bumper/dual hurdling winner but has been pulled up in both chasing attempts; dropped another 5lb and may well come good soon but clearly a deal to prove over fences for now.

stable_tour.quote: Delighted me after beating a good horse of Paul Nicholls' at Hereford  17-11-20

runners.name: Arizona Cardinal
runners.comment: Yet to build upon his winning chase debut but drops in grade here and still has potential
runners.spotlight: Just did enough to make winning seasonal/chase debut at Bangor (2m4f, good to soft) in October; not in same form on next two outings but drops in grade here and probably still has potential; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Tommie Beau
runners.comment: Back in peak form with clear win at Plumpton last month and still on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Returned to peak form with clear win at Plumpton (3m1f, soft) three weeks ago and is now 4-12 over fences; probably still on a workable mark after recent 5lb rise and won't mind if the ground is much quicker here.

quotes.race: Caravan & Motorhome Holidays At Fakenham Racecourse Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tommie Beau has been in fantastic form for us, we raced him over the wrong trip previously as we didn't understand that he needed three miles. It's paid off big time and we've made five times what we paid for Tommie Beau with the bookies. What a horse. - Simon Prout, joint-owner.

runners.name: Old Painless
runners.comment: Made bright start to chasing career in December but comes here with something to prove
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo who made bright start to chasing career on slow ground in December; below form when fifth at Newcastle in January, though, and looked held by Tommie Beau before penultimate-fence unseat at Plumpton last month; needs to get career back on track and prove he can handle today's forecast quicker ground.

runners.name: Shetland Bus
runners.comment: Won twice on good ground in October and probably needed his recent reappearance run
runners.spotlight: Belatedly came good for Richard Newland with two good-ground wins in October (2m6f/3m); pulled up when reappearing on soft ground 12 days ago but ran well to a point and ought to be seen to better effect now back on a quicker surface and with that outing under his belt.

runners.name: The Mighty Arc
runners.comment: Pulled up after weakening quickly on both winter starts; given another wind op since
runners.spotlight: Won comfortably off today's mark in early 2022 but was pulled up after weakening very tamely on both starts this winter and needs latest wind op (his third) to have made a big difference.

stable_tour.quote: He's a real fun horse and has given his owner plenty to smile about this season, winning two of his three races at Worcester and Sedgefield. Fences have been the making of him but he was always going to be a much better chaser. He was meant to go to Leicester last week, but the ground was too quick, so we're now looking at Warwick or Haydock later this month providing he gets his preferred slow ground. He's on a career-high mark now, so we'll see how he handles that. 09-02-22

runners.name: Lounge Lizard
runners.comment: Dominated from the front in first-time blinkers at Catterick in February; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Came good over fences at third attempt when dominating from the front in first-time blinkers at Catterick (3m1f, good) six weeks ago, form that was recently given a good boost by the runner-up; could be hard to catch if he gets into a good rhythm here.

runners.name: Kayf Hernando
runners.comment: In good form with cheekpieces fitted in late 2022; returns from 103-day break here
runners.spotlight: Seemingly boosted by first-time cheekpieces when winning easily by 11l at Taunton (2m7f, good) in November, his second chase, and backed up that performance with very respectable third over same C&D just after Christmas; contender if in similar form again after 103-day break.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kayf Hernando ran nicely in a bumper at the back end of last season and it was a really nice hurdle debut. He raced behind the bridle most of the way, had a good way of going and finished well. He'll handle softer ground - Harry Skelton, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was a little disappointing at Cheltenham but he'd battled really strongly to win at Carlisle on his hurdling debut, beating Mister Whitaker, and maybe that took more out of him than I thought. We'll give him a bit of time and go again. He's going to make a chaser and probably wants 3m. 16-11-21

runners.name: Good Work
runners.comment: Yet to win, but has finished second in five consecutive chases since the autumn
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in five consecutive chases since the autumn, most recently at Warwick (3m1f, soft) three weeks ago; went up another 3lb for that and is likely to encounter faster ground here but seems very likely to give another good account.

runners.name: Debden Bank
runners.comment: Won this off 1lb higher last year and has gone well when fresh before; dangerous to ignore
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner on good ground, latterly off 1lb higher mark in this race last year; absent since below-par hurdle run in October and not very reliable nowadays but has gone well when fresh before and this could be a good day to catch him.

quotes.race: Download The Free At The Races App Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The only concern coming into this was that Debden Bank hadn't run since December. I schooled him yesterday and he was in great order so I kept it simple. He's really improved for a fence - James Best, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Another horse who has kept on improving throughout the year. Having won his final start of 2020 11 months ago off a mark of 91 he has since won another two on the bounce during the summer before a nice break. He returned to action last month at Cheltenham where he badly needed the run. I think we will be looking for a Flat, galloping track for him as I think last time he did not really handle the undulations and a lack of a recent run left him wanting. I can see him continuing to progress with racing and he could make into a cracking chaser. He had a tiny setback after his last run but is fine now and back in fast work. He is still on a competitive mark. 24-11-21

4:35.race_name: At The Races App Market Movers Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Bugle Major

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Fair on the Flat; placed on hurdle debut and has each-way claims again here
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat in his prime and still a fair performer in that sphere; made quite promising hurdle debut when third at Catterick (1m7f, good) in February and probably wasn't suited by the soft ground when well beaten at Fakenham last month; each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: He joined us in the spring having won at Longchamp, Chantilly and Deauville when with Pascal Bary. I thought he ran a cracker of a race last time out in the Royal Hunt Cup where he was hampered at a key time and would have finished much closer. He needs a blistering pace to allow him to come home strong, which he did not get at Royal Ascot. The winner was on the opposite side and made most of the running, which says it all. Ideally he needs a mile and a quarter and I had hoped to go for the John Smith's Cup last weekend but the ground was too slow as he likes it rattling fast. Hopefully he will get his conditions at Glorious Goodwood in the 1m2f handicap. 14-07-21

runners.name: Cabhfuilfungi
runners.comment: Well beaten over 2m7f on hurdling debut a year ago; now with new stable
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in an Irish bumper in spring 2021 but last season's British bumper form was underwhelming, and he was well beaten when upped to 2m7f for hurdling debut a year ago; now with new stable.

runners.name: Captain Attridge
runners.comment: Showed some fair Irish Flat form in 2021 but probably best watched on this hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Showed some fair Flat form in Ireland in 2021 but, following a long layoff, finished last in AW handicap for new stable last month; probably best watched on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Endlesspossibility
runners.comment: Pulled up when 80-1 for last month's hurdle debut; needs to learn to settle
runners.spotlight: Well down the field in Wetherby bumper on rules debut in February and was pulled up here (2m4f) on first attempt over hurdles; needs to learn to settle much better.

runners.name: Even Break
runners.comment: Last of six when 80-1 for Huntingdon bumper on last month's rules debut
runners.spotlight: Has a good jumping pedigree but was last of six when 80-1 for Huntingdon bumper on last month's rules debut.

runners.name: Great Samourai
runners.comment: Bettered disappointing rules debut when clear second at Warwick last month; major player
runners.spotlight: Raced too freely and weakened quickly on rules debut in December but, following a wind op, fared much better when second at Warwick (2m, soft; tongue tied) three weeks ago; that form already makes him the one to beat here, and he can probably improve again.

runners.name: Horse Power
runners.comment: Not beaten far at Uttoxeter in October but not seen again since; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Shaped with some promise and wasn't beaten far when seventh of 11 at Uttoxeter (2m, good) in October, his second run over hurdles, but we haven't seen him again since and others have more compelling form.

runners.name: Hostile Hotelier
runners.comment: Bought for 6,000gns after showing promise in two Irish points this year; rules debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to very smart jumper Fair Along; bought for 6,000gns after showing promise in two Irish points this year; makes rules debut in a race lacking strength in depth; market may guide.

runners.name: Tommouse
runners.comment: Half-brother to useful jumper Run To Milan; hooded for today's debut outing
runners.spotlight: 11th foal; brother to a bumper winner; half-brother to useful jumper Run To Milan and two other jumps winners; dam unraced half-sister to smart jumper No Discount; hooded for debut and entitled to learn from this experience.

runners.name: Townhill
runners.comment: Irish point winner in 2022 but has struggled to make an impact over hurdles this year
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-connected dam and was left clear to make winning Irish point debut last March but has struggled to make any impact on his two hurdling starts this year (2m3f/2m).

runners.name: Shewearsthewellies
runners.comment: Kept on for third at Warwick last month; had about 18l to find with Great Samourai here
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on hurdling debut in February but, with a tongue-tie fitted, took a good step forward when keeping-on third at Warwick (2m, soft) three weeks ago; has about 18l to find with Great Samourai here, though.

runners.name: Our Scholar
runners.comment: Won on Flat in Ireland last year but tailed off after racing too freely on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat in Ireland last summer (1m6f; RPR 63) but raced too freely and was tailed off when switched to hurdling for new stable at Market Rasen (2m, good) in February.

quotes.race: Kilberry Handicap
quotes.quote: Our Scholar is raw but gallops all day. He jumped out and travelled around well. He stays very well and is one to look forward to. I think he'll get better with age as well - Ben Coen, rider.

runners.name: Barony Legends
runners.comment: Unexposed over 3m and sure to appreciate today's ease in grade; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Chasing didn't go to plan during the winter and he made a low-key return to hurdling in February but last month's keeping-on third at Bangor (2m3f, good to soft) was a lot more encouraging; unexposed over 3m and sure to appreciate today's ease in grade; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden hurdle impressively on very soft ground and has chaser written all over him. We're hoping he can become a really nice prospect over fences. Two and a half miles looks to be his optimum trip and testing conditions will be ideal. 27-10-22

He made a very pleasing start to his hurdling career when a 27-length winner at Lingfield over 2m3½f in October and we felt he was well worth stepping up to a Grade 2 novice hurdle at Cheltenham in December, but he was very disappointing. He stopped very quickly and I could not put my finger on it - maybe he swallowed his tongue, but nothing came to light. His work since has been very good and I drove up to Market Rasen last Friday expecting him to get back on the winning trail only for the meeting to be abandoned less than an hour before the off. He is a very impressive looker and will win over hurdles again but should make into a lovely chaser next season. 26-01-22

runners.name: Rocco
runners.comment: Ran quite well at Doncaster in January but has basically become disappointing
runners.spotlight: Ran well for a long way when fourth at Doncaster (3m, good) in January but didn't build on that performance on his latest outing and has basically been very disappointing since his valuable chase win in 2021.

quotes.race: 60th Badger Beer Handicap Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've ridden in the race a few times now and the thing I've learnt is that you have to go quick early to get a nice position or you'll get shuffled back. Rocco jumped fantastic, which really helps. He had a light enough weight on his back, 10st 7lb, and good ground which he wants - Jordan Nailor, jockey.

quotes.race: Join The Coral Champions Club For Free "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Rocco disappointed last season having worked well at home, but a lot didn't go right for him including very soft ground, so this was a bit of a surprise today - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

runners.name: Gentleman Valley
runners.breeder: Mrs P Souverain & Mr A De Boisbrunet
runners.comment: Began season in good form but returned from break with below-par run in February
runners.spotlight: Scored on seasonal debut at Uttoxeter (2m7f, good; first-time tongue-tie) in September and ran at least as well when second at Worcester (2m7f, soft) the following month; returned from a break with a lesser effort in February and needs that outing to have done him good.

stable_tour.quote: He is a bit of a monkey as it is hard to keep the lid on him. He has lots of ability and having won his novice hurdle last season at Kempton he started the new season off in good style, winning on his first attempt in handicap company at Uttoxeter last month. He was given a 7lb hike for that win, which was fair enough, and I would hope he is still on a mark we can work with as he will be campaigned in handicap hurdles this season. 26-10-22

runners.name: Langley Hundred
runners.comment: Dual winner in November and back on track last month; can make his presence felt
runners.spotlight: Came good with two wins under Elizabeth Gale in November (2m7f/3m) and quickly put a poor run behind him when third at Exeter (2m7f, good) last month; probably needs extra to win here but not yet fully exposed.

stable_tour.quote: He was second at Worcester last time but he possibly wants a bit further. I was pleased with his run, though, and hopefully he'll be winning soon. 08-11-22

runners.name: Czech Her Out
runners.comment: Went up 9lb for surprise win last summer and has fitness to prove after 232-day layoff
runners.spotlight: Returned to form to cause 33-1 surprise at Worcester (2m7f, good) last summer but subsequent 9lb rise asks quite a lot of her, and she has fitness to prove after a 232-day layoff.

stable_tour.quote: She did well over the summer, rounding off with a nice win at Worcester in a 2m7f mares' handicap hurdle and that form is working out well. Hopefully she is still on the upgrade and there is more to come. The trick is getting her right as she sometimes has a few small issues which we must work on, but when she is 100 per cent, she is not bad and clearly has a fair level of ability. She is not the biggest mare but we may go chasing as there is such a good programme for mares' chases, but that will not be until the better ground comes back in the spring. 21-11-22

runners.name: Kadex
runners.breeder: Mme Jocelyne Ventrou & Mr Guy Cherel
runners.owner: The Sanguiners, Mrs G Redman & B Painter
runners.comment: Good second at Doncaster in January but well below that form twice since; hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner in France last year and suggested he was ready to exploit some significant help from the British handicapper when second of 15 at Doncaster (3m, good) in January; below that form twice since, though, and now has it all to prove again; tongue-tie refitted.

runners.name: Sir Valentine

prev_owners.owner: Walters Plant Hire & James & Jean Potter

runners.comment: Out of form for new stable this season; tries a new trip today
runners.spotlight: Useful for Nigel Twiston-Davies but, after a long absence, has struggled to get competitive for new stable this season (four runs; 2m-2m4f); tries a new trip today.

quotes.race: Agetur UK Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was lovely. I've always hoped Sir Valentine would put the last day behind him and he jumped and travelled well and his confidence wasn't affected. He quickened nicely at the end. We'll probably look at something under a penalty then maybe we can have aspirations of running him in some nice handicaps. He felt pretty smart - Sam Twiston-Davies, rider.

runners.name: Hillfinch

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late P D Robeson

runners.comment: Comes here after hard-fought win at Huntingdon and remains unexposed as a stayer
runners.spotlight: Suffered a mid-season dip in form but has turned things around lately, and comes here after a hard-fought win at Huntingdon (3m1f, soft) two weeks ago; remains unexposed over this sort of trip and should be fine on today's forecast quicker ground; respected.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The race fell apart for Hillfinch and she's won that well despite hating the ground. As she was running in bumpers early on our options are limited over hurdles but she could turn out again at Doncaster in eight days time to qualify for the EBF final at Newbury - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

runners.name: Kingsfort Hill
runners.comment: Improved form when clear second over C&D last month; goes again off same mark today
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in first two handicap hurdles but significant improvement when clear second over C&D (good to soft) last month, having been heavily backed; gets in off the same mark and remains of strong interest.

runners.name: Freethinker
runners.comment: In excellent form when last seen, but that was over a year ago; market may guide
runners.spotlight: Struck form and won consecutive races on good ground at Newcastle (2m6f/2m7f) last February/March; could quite plausibly have further improvement still to come but a 397-day absence may have checked his momentum.

quotes.race: Cazoo Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Freethinker has taken a lot of patience from his owners. We've had him since he was a three-year-old and we ended up breaking him in every week as he was so wild and so feral. He's the hardest horse we've broken in. It finally clicked at Lingfield, the penny dropped then and he came up here and now he's gone and won again. Lily's given him another cracking ride - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

runners.name: My Girl Lollipop
runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but returned to form and ran big race in defeat at Warwick last month
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over hurdles but returned to form and ran big race in defeat at Warwick (3m2f, soft) last month; only 1lb higher here and will be a tough nut to crack if in similar mood again.

runners.name: Artic Breeze
runners.comment: Irish point winner; has struggled over hurdles; up in trip with cheekpieces added today
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in February 2022 but was well beaten on first four hurdling starts (2m-2m4f) and didn't achieve much when remote second of three last time; combination of step up in trip and first-time cheekpieces may enable improvement on handicap debut, though; worth a glance in the betting.

4:05.race_name: Join Southwell Golf Course Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Groom De Cotte
runners.comment: In the frame in all three handicaps this season; probably on the premises again
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on last spring's handicap debut but has made the frame on all three appearances this season, most recently when second of five at Warwick (2m, heavy) in January; suited by good to soft ground but untested on anything quicker; on the premises if coping with today's conditions.

runners.name: Dom Perry
runners.comment: Won C&D maiden in February and both recent handicap runs were perfectly respectable
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win good-ground C&D maiden on seasonal/stable debut in February and both subsequent handicap runs were respectable; sure to be suited by return to this track; tongue-tie fitted; likely contender.

quotes.race: Fakenham Maiden Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was really worried that Dom Perry would be too green for this race today and he was, really. Let's be honest, that wasn't the strongest bumper that's ever been run but he won well. I think what he really needs is time, so we'll have to decide whether we give him another go in a bumper of go over hurdles next. - Laura Mongan, trainer

runners.name: Perryville
runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles after last month's low-key reappearance; dropped in trip today
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming return from a break at Doncaster last month and is now 0-7 over hurdles (2m3f-2m7f); entitled to have benefited from that outing and drop in trip is an interesting move but others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Casi Crudo
runners.owner: T Acott, L Cross, Sean Cross, P Johnston
runners.comment: Has taken well to hurdling this season and ought to be very competitive on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Nothing special on the Flat but has taken well to hurdling, and won by 11l against own age-group at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) in December; ran better than finishing position suggests when fifth at Wetherby (2m, soft) in January and ought to be competitive again on today's handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: She won her only bumper and we don't win too many of those then finished second at Plumpton yesterday. I wouldn't say she's the biggest in the world but she's gutsy and well bred. 31-10-22

runners.name: Dusky Days
runners.comment: In contention before crashing through wing of penultimate flight last time; others safer
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles and has a rather mixed record; still very much in contention before hanging badly left and crashing through wing of penultimate flight at Ludlow (2m, good) six weeks ago; others safer.

stable_tour.quote: He is an interesting horse in that he has only had one run to date, when winning a bumper at Stratford last May. He is a cracking individual who is a full-brother to the ill-fated Fontsanta, who was a smart stayer. Dusky Days won his bumper nicely and his schooling over hurdles has been very encouraging ahead of his return over 2m, although I expect him to get further later on. I would suggest he is one to follow for the season ahead. 28-09-21

runners.name: Hashehadhisoatsyet
runners.comment: Never dangerous in three maiden/novice hurdles; makes handicap debut off lowly mark
runners.spotlight: Always towards rear and well beaten in three maiden/novice hurdles in November-January (2m-2m3f) but makes his handicap debut from a lowly mark and the forecast quicker ground may enable some improvement.

5:40.race_name: Off The Fence On youtube.com/attheraces Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Manofthemoment
runners.comment: Achieved nothing last month when back from long absence
runners.spotlight: Defied a 2lb higher mark over C&D four years ago and subsequently scored twice over fences; however, achieved nothing last month when back from long absence; needs to prove he retains ability.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Manofthemoment was hanging for much of the way which is something he has done in the past. However, it was difficult to fault his attitude in the closing stages and it will all depend on what the handicapper does as to where he might go next - Noel George, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's nice, an athlete who is a chaser in the making, but he didn't run his race at Warwick on Tuesday. He looked like he would but he emptied. He's still weak but we'll run some tests. 02-11-22

A nicely-bred youngster who could make his debut at Uttoxeter on Friday. We gave him a gallop at Newbury racecourse last season and he looked nice. He is something of a dark horse but I think he will be all right. 26-10-21

runners.name: Lough Carra
runners.comment: Has form figures of 2222 in handicaps at 2m3f/2m4f; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but has been consistent in the main; has form figures of 2222 in handicaps at 2m3f/2m4f; possibilities back up in distance, with Sam Twiston-Davies on board for the first time.

runners.name: Mole Court
runners.comment: Fortunate to open his account at Hereford last time out; mark unchanged
runners.spotlight: Fortunate to open his account at Hereford (2m5f, good) last time out, having been gifted the race when the clear leader took a final-flight fall; however, has an each-way shout off unchanged mark.

runners.name: Cant Beat History
runners.comment: Went close at Doncaster (handicap debut) seven weeks ago; enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Nearly made a winning handicap debut at Doncaster (2m3f, good; favourite) seven weeks ago, going down by only a head; open to further progress at this level and enters calculations up just 3lb.

runners.name: Merveillo
runners.comment: Has not transferred his useful Flat ability to hurdling
runners.spotlight: Listed winner on Flat in France; has not transferred that ability to hurdling, most recently tailed off at Chepstow on handicap debut; represents major connections but has something to prove.

runners.name: Miss Wachit
runners.comment: Sole win for Alex Hales came over C&D; makes debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Sole win for Alex Hales came over C&D (good to soft) last June; absent since chase defeat in August but looks interesting back here on debut for new yard (still with same owner); inspect the market signals.

runners.name: Whenthepennydrops
runners.comment: First-time headgear may prompt improvement; not written off
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has only bits of encouraging form; however, this combination of drop back in trip and first-time headgear may prompt improvement; represents notable connections and can't be written off.

runners.name: My Virtue
runners.comment: Opening mark of 82 isn't burdensome
runners.spotlight: Good-ground point winner; appeared to post her best rules effort when 150-1 fourth in Ludlow novice hurdle last month; that form may not be reliable but an opening mark of 82 isn't exactly burdensome.

runners.name: Lighthouse Mill
runners.comment: Maiden who looks far from solid on form
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and looks far from solid on form (has one standout effort in seven handicap attempts); last three runs poor; opposed.

runners.name: Raqisa
runners.breeder: Minster Stud And Mrs H Dalgety
runners.comment: Only a modest sixth over C&D last month; cheekpieces now added
runners.spotlight: Only a modest sixth over C&D last month when making handicap hurdle debut; however, has the potential for a bigger effort off this mark judged on Flat form; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: The Bandit

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Paul Shanahan & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Drop back to 2m4f may suit on third handicap attempt
runners.spotlight: Made quite an encouraging handicap debut at Uttoxeter (2m4f) in February; failed to progress at Huntingdon (3m1f; eventually pulled up) since but this drop back in distance may suit.

runners.name: Clean Getaway
runners.comment: Modest maiden who has weak form claims
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden who has weak form claims, especially on what he's shown in handicaps; tumbling mark reflects his profile; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He's lively but is a great character. He didn't run as I anticipated in his bumper, but I'm confident he's considerably gifted and suspect we'll try to win a bumper before hurdling. 19-10-21

runners.name: Classic Tune
runners.comment: Won here in 2020 but still needs to prove he retains that ability
runners.spotlight: Teenager who was under pressure when hampered on the final bend in C&D event last month (soon pulled up); defied a stone higher mark here in 2020 but still needs to prove he retains that ability.

quotes.race: Watch Free Race Replays On attheraces.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Classic Tune jumped brilliantly and this was an ideal trip for him. We were getting him ready for the spring then Covid struck so it's great to have a nice family winner - Claire Dyson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Watch Sky Sports In Our Shops Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Classic Tune has always been a nice horse but he's by Scorpion and they've got their own minds. He travelled and jumped great - Claire Dyson, trainer.

runners.name: Cheers Delboy
runners.comment: Thoroughly exposed maiden and lacks recent match practice
runners.spotlight: Doubly unappealing as he's a thoroughly exposed maiden (0-24) and lacks recent match practice having been off since October; placed on occasions but has clear limitations.

3:00.race_name: Follow @attheraces On Twitter Mares' Standard NH Flat Race (Conditional/Amateurs') (GBB) (Div I)

runners.name: After Midnight
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Donald Smith
runners.comment: Not disgraced when midfield on debut but others are much more appealing
runners.spotlight: Out of a 3m hurdle winner; certainly not disgraced when midfield at Warwick (good; hooded) in February but others are much more appealing.

runners.name: Anna Of Annandale
runners.comment: Half-sister to useful hurdler Master Malt and two bumper winners; makes appeal on paper
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-sister to useful hurdler Master Malt and two bumper winners; dam unraced sister to bumper/useful jumps winner Cockney Trucker; in good hands and makes some appeal on paper.

runners.name: Araglen Star
runners.comment: Unable to land a significant blow when 250-1 for debut here last month
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a significant blow when 250-1 for debut here (good to soft) last month.

runners.name: Fortune Forever
runners.comment: Not at best last time but was placed in a big field at Warwick in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Seemingly below-par when only fifth at Warwick (good) in February but her third of 18 there (soft) in November makes her of strong interest here.

runners.name: Madam Ryder
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D & T Futter & Mr B Keogh

runners.name: Miss Controversia
runners.owner: R Whitelock, L Clemitson & R Jefferson
runners.comment: Half-sister to high-class chaser Burton Port; stable does pretty well in bumpers
runners.spotlight: 13th foal; closely related to winners Burtons Well (hurdle/chase), Ratheniska (bumper) and Blazing Port (bumper), half-sister to high-class chaser Burton Port; dam unraced sister to a 7f-1m3f Flat winner; stable does pretty well in bumpers; market reference recommended.

runners.name: Pepite De Amour
runners.comment: Out of a Listed French hurdle winner; stable not prolific in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to winners Jubilympics (bumper/hurdle/chase), Pepite De Belle (hurdle) and Tara Niece (hurdle); dam French/British hurdle winner (including French Listed); nice pedigree, but stable not prolific in bumpers.

runners.name: Sister Julienne
runners.comment: Placed on both starts; her form is nothing out of the ordinary but she enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Out of a useful Irish hurdler and placed on both starts, more recently when close second of six at Hereford (good) in February; that form probably isn't anything out of the ordinary but she still enters calculations.

runners.name: Looking As You Are
runners.breeder: A Hales, Mr & Mrs J Fry, Mr D Fitzgerald
runners.comment: First foal from a low-grade 2m4f hurdle winner; other newcomers look more enticing
runners.spotlight: First foal from a low-grade 2m4f hurdle winner; stable 5-68 (7%) in bumpers in recent seasons; other newcomers look more enticing.

runners.name: Wyenot
runners.breeder: Mrs P Bailey And Miss S Bailey
runners.comment: Closely related to useful chaser Everlastingpromise; stable has respectable bumper record
runners.spotlight: £31,000 3yo; seventh foal; closely related to useful Irish chaser Everlastingpromise, half-sister to winners Nada To Prada (useful bumper/hurdle) and Heavenly Promise (chase); dam 2m hurdle winner; stable has very respectable 10% strike-rate in bumpers.

3:35.race_name: Follow @attheraces On Twitter Mares' Standard NH Flat Race (Conditional/Amateurs') (GBB) (Div II)

runners.name: Bella Madonna
runners.comment: Placed in AW contest two months ago; likely needs to improve in this turf race
runners.spotlight: Outran her 40-1 odds in AW contest at Lingfield two months ago, finishing third; likely needs to find improvement now taking on several interesting types in this turf race.

runners.name: Blow The Budget
runners.comment: Showed some promise at Uttoxeter six months ago; open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise at Uttoxeter (2m, good) six months ago, finishing fifth; open to improvement and needs a close look on return to action; follow the market signals.

runners.name: Endless Supply
runners.comment: Only a modest sixth on rules debut but ought to do better
runners.spotlight: Finished third in Irish point; only a modest sixth at Chepstow (2m, soft) on rules debut but she's in good hands and ought to do better.

runners.name: Little Miss Dante
runners.breeder: N J Henderson And Mrs S A Aston
runners.comment: Solid second at Huntingdon in January (winner has gone well in Listed grade since)
runners.spotlight: Related to two winners for her stable; duly made a promising debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) in January, finishing close second behind a mare who has been placed in Listed grade since; leading player.

runners.name: Lizzie Rey
runners.comment: Half-sister to the yard's dual bumper winner Pop Mistress; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to the yard's dual bumper winner (including over C&D on debut) Pop Mistress; interesting newcomer, especially if the market speaks positively.

runners.name: Rogue Queen
runners.comment: Has made the frame in two races at Warwick; major contender on form
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame in two races at Warwick (2m, good/good to soft), finishing second (behind a subsequent hurdle winner) in November then fourth in February; major contender on form.

runners.name: The Pit Popsy
runners.comment: Inauspicious debut at Wincanton last month
runners.spotlight: Inauspicious debut (tailed-off last) at Wincanton last month; best watched.

runners.name: Jersey Gem
runners.comment: £32,000 3yo; related to numerous bumper scorers; very appealing on paper
runners.spotlight: £32,000 3yo; dam bumper/hurdle winner, sister to winners Twelve Roses (useful bumper/jumps) and Cinderella Rose (bumper/hurdle), half-sister to four bumper winners out of bumper winner; very appealing on paper.

runners.name: Persian Willow
runners.comment: £18,000 3yo; has bumper winners in her pedigree; check the betting
runners.spotlight: £1,000 yearling, £18,000 3yo; half-sister to four winners, including two bumper scorers; dam sister to bumper/smart jumps winner Our Ben; wears tongue-tie on debut; check the betting.

runners.name: Escape Route
runners.comment: 1m2f winner on his penultimate start; ran well off his revised mark ten days ago; claims
runners.spotlight: Suited by the step up to 1m2f when staying on strongly to score on his penultimate start; posted a pleasing effort off his revised mark ten days ago; strong claims stepping back up in trip.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and Escape Route has shown a nice attitude. He was a little bit green early on, but he was drawn on the outside and needed time to find his feet. He's a bit backward but he's been going well at home and should improve a lot from that - Danny Tudhope, rider.

runners.name: Enjoying
runners.breeder: China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Ben Wong Chung Mat

prev_owners.owner: China Horse Club, S C Khaw Et Al
China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd, S C Khaw Et Al

runners.comment: Yet to really fire this season and has been well beaten in his last two starts
runners.spotlight: Yet to really fire this season and has been well beaten in his last two starts; 10lb below his last winning mark so better is expected at some point.

runners.name: Above
runners.breeder: D F & Mrs M D Bodle
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Paul Kan Man Lok

prev_owners.owner: Mr & Mrs Paul Kan Man Lok

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last season; mixed record this term; 1lb below his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last season; mixed record this term after posting consecutive placed efforts in September/October; now 1lb below his last winning mark.

runners.name: Natural Storm
runners.comment: C&D winner in December; back to form in last two starts; place claims at the very least
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in December; back to form on last two starts after posting a modest effort at the start of the year; place contender at the very least.

runners.name: Cant Go Wong
runners.breeder: J S Alexander, W Bevins Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ciaron Maher Racing, M Tsang Et Al

runners.comment: Yet to make a significant impact after five Hong Kong starts; remains best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Group 2-placed in Australia last year but yet to make a significant impact after five Hong Kong runs and seemingly in need of further help from the local handicapper.

runners.name: S J Tourbillon

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Safely held since securing a breakthrough victory in October; 4lb below last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Secured a narrow breakthrough victory over 1m1f in October but has been safely held in seven subsequent starts; 4lb below his last winning mark and should be showing more.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: he's been nurtured along so, I suppose, Group/Classic material is where they really want to end up. I'd be happy enough to say a mile is comfortable enough for him, maybe even back a furlong starting next year - Seamie Heffernan, jockey

runners.name: Total Power
runners.comment: Kept on for 25-1 second in November but his other four runs this season have been poor
runners.spotlight: Kept on for 25-1 second at Sha Tin in November but his other four runs this season have been disappointing; percentage call is to oppose.

runners.name: Round The Earth
runners.comment: Fourth in a blanket finish at Sha Tin in February; modest in two starts since
runners.spotlight: Unlucky not to get off the mark when fourth in a blanket finish over 1m1f at Sha Tin in February; modest in two subsequent starts so needs to get back on track today.

runners.name: Cordyceps One
runners.comment: Runner-up in a Class 4 event last month; warrants plenty of respect in this grade
runners.spotlight: Yet to strike in ten starts this season but posted a good effort when runner-up over C&D in a Class 4 event last month; 1lb below his last winning mark and warrants plenty of respect in this grade.

runners.name: To Infinity
runners.owner: Chan Wing Chiu & Yildiz Choi Yat Fan
runners.comment: Gained his breakthrough victory over C&D last month; 5lb rise to overcome today
runners.spotlight: Had been struggling to make an impact this season but took a big step forward when gaining his breakthrough victory over C&D last month; 5lb rise to overcome today but remains open to further progress.

runners.name: Over The Moon
runners.owner: Lai Kim Wai & Lai Ka Yee
runners.comment: Back on track at Sha Tin last month; looks capable of striking off his current mark
runners.spotlight: 0-12 but got back on track when making the frame over 1m at Sha Tin last month; looks more than capable of striking off his current mark; high on the list.

runners.name: Tycoon Jewellery
runners.comment: Posted an improved effort when fourth over C&D last month; now needs to build on that run
runners.spotlight: Showed very little in his first five starts this season but did post an improvement effort when finishing fourth over C&D last month; now needs to build on that run.

runners.name: Charizard
runners.comment: Hinting at another visit to the winner's enclosure in recent months; likely to play a role
runners.spotlight: Now 10lb lower than when scoring over C&D last season and has been hinting at another visit to the winner's enclosure in recent months; likely to play a big role.

runners.name: Jolly Honour
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Philip Ng Yuk Wing & Michael Ng Mun Kit
runners.comment: Recent efforts suggest he may be about to snap a losing sequence; claims under Zac Purton
runners.spotlight: Losing run dates back to March 2020 but recent efforts suggest he may be about to snap that sequence; was unlucky not to score when suffering a narrow defeat last month; claims under Zac Purton.

runners.name: Glorious Lover
runners.comment: 0-35 but has been suggesting his turn may be near; wide draw a slight negative today
runners.spotlight: 0-35 but has been suggesting his turn may be near since dropping down into this grade; wide draw a slight negative today but every chance of being involved if negotiating a safe passage; headgear removed.

runners.name: Mighty Star
runners.comment: 0-9 and struggling to make any impression; can only be watched at present
runners.spotlight: 0-9 and struggling to make any impression; can only be watched at present.

runners.name: Ho Ho Junior
runners.comment: Disappointing when only midfield last month; outside place claims if getting back on track
runners.spotlight: Did show some improvement when finishing fourth over C&D on his penultimate start but was again disappointing when only midfield last month; outside place claims if getting back on track.

runners.name: Faithful Trinity
runners.comment: Made it consecutive placed efforts last month; a long way below his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Made it consecutive placed efforts when third over C&D last month; a long way below his last winning mark so dangerous to ignore.

runners.name: Golden Mission
runners.comment: Yet to really get going in five starts this term; returns to his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: In good form towards the end of last season, scoring twice over 6f; yet to really get going in five starts this term but does now return to his last winning mark; better can be expected.

runners.name: Fortune Winner
runners.comment: Safely held on his debut for Richard Gibson last month; remains best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Disappointing for his previous two trainers and was again safely held on his debut for Richard Gibson last month; remains best watched until posting a more convincing performance.

runners.name: Heavenly Thought
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Patrick Lau Tak Wai & William Lau Man Yuen

runners.comment: In relatively good form this season; no concerns stepping up to this trip; respected
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2020 and patently not the force of old but has been in relatively good form this season, placing three times over 6f; no concerns stepping up to this trip; respected.

runners.name: Cable Speed
runners.comment: Weakened under a positive ride six days ago; more needed off his current mark
runners.spotlight: Made his belated Hong Kong breakthrough over 1m1f here on his penultimate start; weakened under a positive ride six days ago; more needed off his current mark.

runners.name: Prime Mortar
runners.comment: Cosy C&D winner in January and followed up on his only start since; key player
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the sixth attempt with a comfortable C&D success in January and doubled up the following month; 7lb higher again now but no telling where his improvement might end; key player.

runners.name: Diamond Flare
runners.comment: A winner in Australia but struggling to get to grips with HK so far; best watched
runners.spotlight: Won over 5.5f in Australia but has made little impact in a handful of starts from 5f-7f since landing in Hong Kong; remains early days and can surely do better but a watching brief is advised at present.

runners.name: Telecom Speed
runners.comment: 0-8 in HK but getting closer in recent months; plenty of positives but draw looks tricky
runners.spotlight: Still seeking a first Hong Kong success but is 8lb better off with Prime Mortar following his third to that rival over C&D in January; nothing wrong with efforts since but has a tricky draw to overcome.

runners.name: See U Again
runners.owner: Leonard Fong Lik Man & Chong Yih Sam
runners.comment: Shed his maiden status over C&D two runs ago but comfortably held from this mark since
runners.spotlight: Made it 14th-time lucky with a narrow success over C&D four weeks ago but seemingly no excuses when well beaten from this mark on his only start since; drawn wider than ideal here too.

runners.name: Wood On Fire
runners.comment: Multiple C&D winner who was back to form with a win last time out; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Won for the sixth time over C&D when snapping a losing run in good style four weeks ago; 6lb higher this time but has won from significantly higher marks in the past; each-way claims.

runners.name: Above All
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Paul Kan Man Lok
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last year and now back to a good mark; lack of recent form the worry
runners.spotlight: Won three from four (including twice over C&D) in April/May of last year; form dipped subsequently but has gradually worked his way back to a reasonable mark; lack of solid recent form the worry.

runners.name: Amazing Travis
runners.breeder: Haunui Bloodstock Ltd (Nz), Dr A T & Mrs
runners.comment: Well beaten in two starts over C&D so far; bred to do better over further in due course
runners.spotlight: Little impact in two starts to date (both C&D) and pedigree strongly suggests that he will come into his own over a longer trip further down the line; best to look elsewhere.

runners.name: Spicy So Smart
runners.comment: Best effort yet when fourth over C&D latest; any improvement brings him into the equation
runners.spotlight: Stepped forward markedly on first two runs when fourth over C&D latest, only fading late on; has been dropped another pound since and any further improvement will see him competitive.

runners.name: Island Surprise
runners.comment: Consistent performer over C&D but does not look well handicapped now; place chance
runners.spotlight: Has a consistent profile this season, winning a C&D handicap in this grade in November and hitting the frame on several other occasions; creeping up the weights now but unlikely to be far away.

runners.name: One For All
runners.owner: Fung Ka Pun, Kenneth Ting Woo Shou Et Al
runners.comment: Confirmed stamina for this trip with C&D win last time out; 5lb rise makes this tougher
runners.spotlight: Confirmed stamina for this trip when making all over C&D three weeks ago; only had a head to spare on that occasion and could find mandatory 5lb rise in the weights insurmountable.

runners.name: Charming Steed
runners.comment: Well-handicapped previous C&D winner but recent form leaves plenty of room for improvement
runners.spotlight: Now 12lb below last May's C&D winning mark but form has taken a turn for the worse since; marginally better over 7f 10 days ago and debatable whether this return to sprinting is the answer.

runners.name: Plentiful
runners.comment: Encouraging debut in March but has failed to recapture the form in two more recent runs
runners.spotlight: Far from disgraced on debut over C&D in early March but has failed to hit the same heights in two starts since; remains low mileage but plenty more needed (also a reserve in the 2.45).

quotes.race: Naas Nursery Of Champions Race
quotes.quote: A mile would probably suit Storm Legend better as he just grinds away. The plan is for him to go to Hong Kong in August and he might run in the Group 3 Bonhams Thoroughbred Stakes at Goodwood on the way there to quarantine. He could make up into a Hong Kong Derby horse. He'll definitely get a mile and he could get a mile and a quarter as there is plenty of stamina in his pedigree - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Storm Legend travelled with ease after being a bit keen early on. When I gave him a squeeze he took off. He goes to Fozzy Stack I believe and he is one I would be looking forward to ride next year - Chris Hayes, rider

quotes.race: Hampton Court Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: That was an excellent run from the first three horses. Berlin Tango will go to the Dante Stakes at York next, which has been moved to July this year - Andrew Balding, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Classic Trial Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Berlin Tango would need to be supplemented for the Derby and that would be a brave shout. We'll probably look at something at Ascot for him if it does not come too soon and he should have a very good summer because he's a smart horse - Andrew Balding, trainer.  He's definitely one for the future. The race panned out well and we got a good sit from his draw in six. He's definitely grown up from last year. His homework has been excellent and has improved stacks over the winter. I'm sure he will stay a mile and a half with that freshness out of him now. He's well balanced so a course like Epsom could suit him but there are plenty of other options if that's not the case but you have to be pretty special to do it like that after pulling mid-race - David Probert, jockey.

quotes.race: Thank You Owners For Supporting This Town Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Liffey River galloped the whole way. He did it nicely. He's a big strong horse and coped with the ground well. He's a colt with a nice future - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: He disappointed me a little on his comeback at Gowran Park. I was hoping for a bit more. We might drop him in class. 19-04-21

quotes.race: Read Nick Luck's Blog At news.williamhill.com EBF Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: I'm delighted. Gorytus is quite a nice horse but on paper it looked a competitive race and it was nice to run well. We'll see how he is and how the form works out but the Acomb was a race I'd earmarked for him - Richard Fahey, trainer.

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P J Seldon, Miss P E Seldon Et Al

stable_tour.quote: When the yearlings come in you can usually spot the nice ones straightaway and this fellow stood out in the pack. I like his sire and he has left his stamp on this colt who is physically gorgeous, sound, strong, a good mover and has an excellent temperament. This fellow made a very pleasing debut at Haydock in May and it did him the power of good. He came forward for that and I expected a big run last week at Doncaster, when he did not disappoint with a 4L win. Potentially he could be anything as our juveniles usually come on a lot for their initial efforts. The plan immediately after that was the Superlative Stakes this week but I spoke to his owner afterwards and he is a very patient man with his horses and suggested we may wait a little longer, in which case the Listed Pat Eddery Stakes at Ascot on 24 July would be the target. This son of Churchill has always looked a cut above my others and the lads that have ridden him at home have all said he feels like a proper horse. I think he has a very bright future and could be anything. I know it is early days but he could be very smart indeed. 07-07-21
